courses.title: Why projects fail. Three lifewheels.
courses.bio: 70% of the world's projects fail (source: Standish Group). How to increase your own success rate in project management.
objectives: How to avoid numerous, endless, sometimes chimerical, project changes using the Trade-Off Matrix.
How to manage deviations in the course of a project using simple deviation classification and Baseball Game principles.
How to keep project execution on track by relying on the Short Interval Control (SIC) mechanism.
How to increase the individual success rate in difficult projects and in a complex, challenging business environment.

TRADE OFF MATRIX - MY OWN SITUATIONS: TRADE OFF MATRIX - MY OWN SITUATIONS
TEST - TRADE OFF MATRIX CASES TO SOLVE: TEST - TRADE OFF MATRIX CASES TO BE SOLVED
TRADE OFF MATRIX - WRAP UP + ADDITIONAL: TRADE OFF MATRIX - WRAP UP + ADDITIONAL READING TO DOWNLOAD

requirements: You should have a basic knowledge of project management. No certification (e.g. PRINCE2, PMP, ScrumMaster) is required.
courses.description:
Why should you consider the course?
Known recipe for a successful project like:
- appointing professional project managers;
- appointing a competent project team;
- developing a coherent project blueprint;
- and the use of appropriate project tools, it doesn't work.
70% of projects around the world fail (soucre: Standish Group). Even if these principles are fully followed.

Why is this happening? What is missing?
Because there are three traps that a project manager and his team can fall into.
These are:
1) Endless, sometimes chronic and chimerical changes in project goals, scope, specifications, schedule, budget;
2) Unexpected deviations from the plan. People basically know how to run a project when things go well. When things go badly - they don't necessarily deal with it anymore;
3) Failure to meet deadlines and deliver expected results despite project monitoring;
The course is very practical.
I will share with you three lifewheels for projects.
All will be presented using my own experience.


What will you learn in this course?
- How to manage project changes in advance using the Trade Off Matrix technique;
- how to manage deviations using the Deviation Baseball Game model;
- how to ensure the desired project pace using the Short Interval Control (SIC) mechanism;
- how to increase your individual project success rate;


Who should attend the course?
I. Beginners who are starting their adventure in project management
II. Practitioners who have quite a bit of experience in projects
III. Project management trainers and mentors
IV. Students of business, management, economics


What is needed to take the course?
- only very basic knowledge of projects
- no certificates are required


How is the course organized?
Each individual project lifebelt will be presented in 6 steps:
1. A brief introduction about the tool
2. Several examples illustrating how the tool works
3. The instructor's own cases on the use of the tool
4. Summary of knowledge and its verification through a quiz
5. 2-3 real cases to be solved by the participant
6. Additional reading on the tool to be downloaded


Why me?
In my 30 years in business, I delivered 50 large-scale projects as a project manager.
These included:
- transformation projects
- Improvement projects (Lean, SixSigma)
- Modeling of managerial decisions
- Changing the size of the organization
- Changing cultural mentality
Across business sectors:
- Medical Devices & Diagnostics
- Banking & Investment Finance
- Shared services
- Business consulting
target_audience: Beginners: you are embarking on your first project and are concerned about whether you can get it right.
Experienced practitioners: you have knowledge and experience in project management. You still face challenges, difficulties and would like to find a good recipe on how to deal with them.
Mentors: you teach, offer coaching and mentoring to your project managers. You are looking for good, proven methods to help them grow in project management.
Students: you are studying business, management and would like to acquire proven, practical project management knowledge to become a project management professional in the future.

120 Minutes to do the Practice Test
75% Passing Percentage
Domain areas and Tasks:
The Disciplined Agile Coach
Facilitate the DA Way
Engage the Stakeholders
Communicate Continuously
Mentorship & Leadership

Coaching, Consulting, Counseling, & Lean Leadership
Training & Development
Thought Leadership
DAC Eligibility Requirements:
The eligibility for the DAC certification requires three years of agile experience and the Disciplined Agile Senior Scrum Master (DASSM) certification to ensure in-depth knowledge of the DA tool kit, along with the practices and strategies it contains.
Candidates will be required to attend a three-day training course offered by a PMI Authorized Training Provider.
Upon completion of the three-day course, candidates are admitted into the exclusive DAC Community of Practice, which provides additional learning, exam preparation opportunities, and the DAC Case Study.
Questions matched to the DAC case study are represented within each domain of the DAC examination blueprint.
DAC Examination Information:
Total Examination Questions: 60 multiple-choice questions
Allotted Examination Time: 120 minutes
The total time to complete the DAC examination including disclosures and tutorials is 150 minutes.
A passing score is not made available for DA certifications, please check PMI Certification Guideline before applying.
What you will get from us:
Provide high-quality scenario-based questions to help you get ready for your DAC exam certification.
Help you wear the project manager hat and deal with different scenario-based problems with a project management mindset through an in-depth explanation.
Test your understanding of project management and Agile principles. Going through all the ten knowledge areas, the five process groups, the three domains, and the agile principles with reference to the PMI-Agile Practice Guide.
Answer all your questions and concerns through the course Q&A with a detailed explanation.


The DAC certification is a professional experience-based certification. Experience leading and directing projects is critical to a DAC candidate's success. Training alone is not sufficient to pass the exam.
These materials were developed by experts familiar with the exam content outline but these individuals did NOT participate in developing the PMI DAC exam.


Disclaimer: “PMBOK”, “PMP”, DAC, DASM, DASSM, and “PMI” are registered trademarks of the Project Management Institute, Inc.
These practice tests are not endorsed by, nor in partnership, nor affiliated with Project Management Institute, Inc.

courses.title: Project Management - How to Schedule Management Plan
courses.bio: Learn schedule development tools. techniques, methodologies, and best practices.
objectives: Overview of PM’s responsibilities
Project management process overview
What is a Schedule Management Plan
Schedule Management Plan layout
Exercise

Course Modules: First sections of Project Schedule Management Plan (ScMP)

requirements: Knowledge of Project Management
courses.description:
Embark on a transformative journey with Jamal, a seasoned project management consultant, in this comprehensive course on Schedule Management. Drawing from his 25 years of experience in consulting and managing major projects, Jamal shares valuable insights and practical techniques to master the art of schedule management.
Beginning with an overview of the project manager's responsibilities, we explore the vital role of the schedule management plan within the overall project plan. We then dive into the key steps of the schedule management process, including Activity Definition, Activity Sequencing, Activity Resource Estimating, Activity Duration Estimating, Schedule Development, and Schedule Control.
Within Schedule Development, we explore various tools and techniques, such as software commonly used for scheduling, Activity Sequencing using methods like Precedence diagramming (PDM) and Arrow diagramming (ADM), and Activity Duration Estimation employing expert judgment, analogous estimating (Top-Down), engineering estimating (Bottom-Up), and network diagrams including PERT and Critical Path methods.
Continuing our exploration, we delve into project schedule controls methodologies, including Variance Analysis, which involves comparing Scheduled Time with Actual Time, and Earned Value Management (EVM), where metrics like SV, SPI, EAC, ETC, and VAC provide valuable insights.
We also examine schedule variance tolerances and discuss the levels at which they should be tracked. Additionally, we explore several methods for the Schedule Variance Response Process, equipping you with effective strategies to address deviations from the planned schedule.
Subsequently, we shift our focus to Project Schedule with the aid of real-life examples, enabling you to better understand practical implementation. We also explore the Schedule Change Control Process, which involves Schedule Control and managing schedule changes through the Change Request document. Furthermore, we discuss assessing the impact of changes on the overall project.
To reinforce your learning, you will be provided with an assignment that challenges you to create your own Schedule Management Plan, applying the knowledge and techniques acquired throughout the course. This hands-on exercise, such as planning a bathroom or kitchen renovation project, allows you to practically apply the principles of schedule management.
Enroll in this course led by Jamal and acquire the expertise to effectively manage project schedules. Gain valuable skills in scheduling tools and techniques, variance analysis, earned value management, and change control. Propel your project management career forward with the mastery of Schedule Management.
target_audience: You are a project manager who runs medium to large-size projects
You are a business analyst who is responsible for interactions with stakeholders on medium or large-size projects
You are a technical resource who is planning on participating in a project

objectives: Agile approach Foundation level material. Exam preparation material.

courses.description:
Agile is an approach for a successful project delivery. I would like to emphasize the word, successful as mostly Agile focuses on achieving the expected goals and results.
Agile is based on DSDM framework, which stands for Dynamic System Development Method. DSDM was found in 1994 by a group of IT Practitioners, to improve the traditional approach.
DSDM is a method of incremental delivery of parts of the solution. It means, that in DSDM Project is divided on increments and so the solution is delivered partially, to deliver the expected level of quality.
The course is more focused on theory of Agile and introduces you with basics of methodology. These knowledges will be also enough to start a career in Project Management or open your own business.
After completing this course you will be prepared for the Foundation level exam. If you want to pass the exam, please watch the course till the last video, as at the exam, there may be any question from each section.
This course is for people, who want to know how to build project or business succesfully. Understanding of Project Management is good, but knowing how to successfuly build it are in demand everywhere.
target_audience: Students and people interested in Projects and business

courses.description:
This course provides an in-depth exploration of sustainable project management, focusing on the core principles, strategies, and frameworks that drive sustainability in today’s project environments. Designed to equip you with a thorough understanding of sustainability in project management, the course emphasizes key concepts such as the triple bottom line, stakeholder engagement, and sustainable resource management.
The curriculum begins with an introduction to the fundamentals of sustainable project management, laying a strong theoretical foundation for understanding how sustainability integrates into various phases of project execution. You’ll explore sustainability's role in project objectives and the challenges and opportunities that arise when aligning project goals with environmental and social responsibilities.
The course also emphasizes the importance of stakeholder engagement, offering insights into identifying and prioritizing stakeholders, developing communication plans that promote transparency, and fostering collaborative decision-making. These elements are critical to managing expectations and building consensus for sustainability initiatives within project teams and organizations.
Sustainable planning and design are integral to the curriculum, with a focus on incorporating sustainability into project design, selecting sustainable materials and technologies, and using tools and techniques that support long-term project durability. This section highlights how lifecycle assessments and design for adaptability can enhance project outcomes while minimizing environmental impact.
Resource management is another key focus, where you will explore principles of resource efficiency, sustainable sourcing, and strategies for managing water, energy, and materials in a way that reduces waste and promotes circular economy concepts.
The course also covers risk assessment and sustainability, guiding you through identifying sustainability-related risks, conducting environmental impact assessments, and implementing risk mitigation strategies that enhance project resilience. The goal is to equip you with the knowledge needed to monitor and respond to sustainability risks effectively.
Throughout the course, you’ll gain insights into the implementation and execution of sustainable projects, with a focus on best practices, team management, and overcoming common challenges. You’ll also learn about performance measurement and reporting, including developing sustainability metrics, using tools to assess sustainability performance, and reporting outcomes to stakeholders.
Finally, governance and ethics in sustainable project management are explored, including the role of leadership, governance structures, and compliance with international sustainability standards. This section delves into creating a culture of sustainability within organizations, emphasizing ethical considerations and long-term sustainability goals.
By the end of this course, you will have developed a comprehensive understanding of the theoretical frameworks that support sustainable project management, preparing you to contribute to projects that prioritize environmental stewardship and social responsibility.

This course provides a comprehensive understanding of risk management principles and practices, essential for aspiring project managers seeking PMI-RMP certification or enhancing their project management skills.
Section 1: PMI-RMP - Risk Management Plan and Strategy
In this section, learners will delve into the fundamentals of risk management planning and strategy. They will gain insights into the essential components of a Risk Management Plan (RMP), including its development, utilization, and the identification of risk categories and sources. Through lectures and examples, students will learn how to assess risk factors and inputs from various project components, enabling them to formulate effective risk mitigation strategies.
Section 2: PMI-RMP - Stakeholder Engagement
This section focuses on stakeholder analysis and engagement strategies, crucial for project success. Learners will explore the importance of stakeholder management plans and proactive engagement techniques to ensure project alignment with stakeholder interests. Through case studies and real-world examples, students will develop the skills to identify, analyze, and manage stakeholder expectations, fostering productive relationships throughout the project lifecycle.
Section 3: PMI-RMP - Risk Process Facilitation
The third section delves into quantitative and qualitative risk analysis techniques essential for effective risk management. Students will learn how to perform risk assessments, utilize tools such as Monte Carlo Analysis, and assess risk data quality to inform decision-making. Through practical applications and simulations, participants will gain proficiency in developing risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans to address potential project threats.
Section 4: PMI-RMP - Human Resource Management
This section explores the role of leadership styles, team dynamics, and conflict management in project environments. Learners will examine various theories of motivation and their application in managing project teams effectively. By understanding the principles of human resource management, students will acquire the skills to foster collaboration, resolve conflicts, and optimize team performance to mitigate project risks.
Section 5: PMI-RMP - Communication Management
Effective communication is vital for successful risk management. In this section, participants will learn how to plan, manage, and control project communication to ensure stakeholders remain informed and engaged. Through case studies and communication models, students will explore different communication methods, stakeholder engagement strategies, and best practices for conveying project status and updates.
Section 6: PMI-RMP - Risk Monitoring and Reporting
This section focuses on monitoring and reporting mechanisms essential for tracking project risks and ensuring timely decision-making. Learners will explore enterprise risk management frameworks, tools for risk monitoring and reporting, and techniques for trend analysis. By mastering risk monitoring and reporting processes, students will be equipped to identify emerging risks, assess project performance, and implement corrective actions to mitigate potential threats.
Section 7: PMI-RMP - Risk Governance & Framework
The final section examines risk governance structures and frameworks essential for effective risk management governance. Students will gain insights into risk governance boards, risk committee responsibilities, and the implementation of risk response strategies. Through case studies and frameworks like Risk IT and CMMI, learners will understand how to establish risk management frameworks, assess organizational risk culture, and ensure alignment with strategic objectives.

courses.description:
The world of risk management is all about navigating the unknown. Processes, frameworks, and plans provide structure, but people remain at the heart of every project’s success.
Artificial intelligence can analyse data, model scenarios, and flag potential risks, but it cannot understand human motivation, empathy, or trust. These qualities are essential for building resilient teams and managing uncertainty with confidence.
This course puts people at the centre of risk management. It explores how emotional intelligence underpins a strong risk-aware culture through motivation, empathy, open communication, and effective mitigation strategies.
You will learn how leaders use critical thinking, analytical skills, and courage to make sound decisions that balance risk and reward. More importantly, you will see how emotionally intelligent leadership inspires trust and shapes the emotional climate in which risk management thrives.


The Human-Centred Risk Management Beyond the Limits of AI course covers

The intersection of risk management principles and emotional intelligence skills
How emotions influence behaviour, communication, and performance
The identification, assessment, and mitigation of risk from a human-centred perspective.
Practical strategies for empowering people and managing performance in risk-sensitive environments.
The limits of AI in risk management and how human judgment bridges the gap.


Why Take The Human-Centred Risk Management Beyond the Limits of AI Course?

By integrating technical strategies with the human element, this course helps project leaders and professionals build stronger, more adaptable teams. You will gain the tools to manage not just the risks themselves, but also the emotions and behaviours that determine how risks are addressed.
Human-centred risk management goes beyond the limits of AI because at the core of every project are people.


By completing this course, you will be able to:

Explain how emotional intelligence influences risk perception, decision-making, and team responses in ways that AI cannot replicate
Recognise how emotional intelligence skills underpin effective risk identification, assessment, and mitigation
Develop practical strategies for working constructively with emotions in high-risk situations
Evaluate communication approaches that build trust and psychological safety when discussing and managing risk
Enhance communication and collaboration to support balanced, informed risk-based decisions.
Create an action plan that applies your emotional intelligence skills to strengthen risk management beyond the limits of AI
By prioritising emotional intelligence and people management skills, a more risk-aware culture can be encouraged to navigate uncertainty and achieve success in risk management projects.

courses.title: PRINCE2 PRACTITIONER (PRACTICE EXAM) (NEW)
courses.bio: THIS PRACTICE TEST WILL HELP YOU BE READY AND PASS YOUR EXAM ON THE FIRST ATTEMPT.
courses.description:
PRINCE2 Practitioner certification is suitable for anyone managing projects. This could be as part of a formal project management function or a role which involves project management as part of day-to-day work. The Practitioner certification aims to confirm that you have sufficient knowledge and understanding to apply and tailor the method in a range of different project environments and scenarios.
Attaining your Practitioner qualification is only one part of becoming a successful and effective project manager. It is important to ensure that yous upplement this with real-life experience working on projects, in addition to investing in personal professional development and wider training.
The PRINCE2 Practitioner certification will expire after 3 years. In order to maintain your qualification and ensure there are no gaps in your Practitioner status, you can either retake the PRINCE2 Practitioner Exam before the expiry date or maintain your certification through CPD points and a digital badge.
Differences from PMP:
Project Management Professional (PMP) from Project Management Institute may be seen as a competitor of PRINCE2. In general, the UK, Australia prefer PRINCE2, and the US and American countries prefer PMP. Asia, Africa and the Middle East area have no strong preference for PMP or PRINCE2. The important thing is that PMP (PMBOK) can be used with PRINCE2.
PRINCE2 and PMP acknowledge each other's existence in their advertising material and attempt to position themselves as complementary products – PRINCE2 as a "methodology" and PMP as a "standard"[26] – which can be used alongside each other. In practice, companies and practitioners choose one system or both depending on the project environment, their geographical location and costs involved.

courses.title: PMBOK Guide 7th Edition Masterclass (Agile & Hybrid Lectures
courses.bio: PMBOK Guide 7th Edition - Deep Dive into Agile & Hybrid
objectives: Understand PMBOK Guide 7th Edition Basics
Understand the PMBOK 7th Edition Principles
Be able to explain the PMBOK 7th Performance Domains
Explain PMBOK 7th Edition
requirements: Intermediate knowledge of project management and agile
courses.description:
The Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK Guide) is a comprehensive guide to the fundamental concepts, principles, and practices of project management. The seventh edition of the PMBOK  Guide was released in 2021, and it includes a number of significant changes from previous editions.


This crash course will provide you with a high-level overview of the key concepts and principles of project management as defined in the PMBOK  Guide 7th Edition.


In this crash course, you will learn the 12 principles and 8 performance domains of project management as defined in the PMBOK  Guide 7th Edition.


In the second part of the course, I will be joined by Roy Schilling, CSP, CSM, PMI-ACP and the PMP graduates from the Project Leadership Institute to thoroughly analyze the PMBOK Guide Seventh Edition from an Agile, Hybrid and Predictive perspective. A great refresher for CAPM exam students taking the new 2023 CAPM Exam and PMP students alike.


PRINCIPLES
Stewardship - Project managers are responsible for the project and its resources. They must use the resources wisely and ensure that the project is completed on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards.


Team - The project team is essential to the success of the project. Project managers must create a high-performing team and build trust and cooperation among team members.


Stakeholders - Stakeholders are the people or organizations that have an interest in the project. Project managers must identify all of the stakeholders, understand their needs, and develop plans to meet those needs.


Value - The project must deliver value to the organization. This means that the project must meet the organization's needs and objectives.


Systems thinking - Project managers must consider the project as a system, with all of its interrelated parts. This means that project managers must understand how changes in one part of the project can impact other parts of the project.


Leadership - Project managers must be leaders and facilitators. They must be able to motivate and inspire the team, and they must be able to resolve conflicts.


Tailoring - The project must be tailored to the specific needs of the organization. This means that project managers must consider the organization's culture, resources, and goals when planning and executing the project.


Quality - The project must meet the quality requirements. This means that the project must produce products or services that meet the organization's standards.


Complexity - Projects are complex and require a holistic approach. This means that project managers must consider all aspects of the project, including the technical, organizational, and human factors.


Risk - Risks must be identified, assessed, and managed. This means that project managers must identify potential risks, assess the likelihood and impact of those risks, and develop plans to mitigate the risks.


Adaptability and Resilience - The project must be adaptable and resilient to change. This means that project managers must be prepared for changes in the project's environment, such as changes in the market, the technology, or the organization.


Change - Change is inevitable and must be managed. This means that project managers must be prepared for changes in the project, and they must have a plan for managing those changes.


PERFORMANCE DOMAINS:
The 8 performance domains are:


Stakeholders - The project manager must effectively interact with stakeholders to ensure that their needs are met.


Team - The project manager must create a high-performing team and build trust and cooperation among team members.


Development Approach and Life Cycle - The project manager must select the appropriate development approach and life cycle for the project.


Planning - The project manager must develop a detailed plan that outlines the work that needs to be done, the resources that will be needed, and the timeline for completion.


Project Work - The project manager must ensure that the project work is completed in accordance with the plan.


Delivery - The project manager must deliver the project on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards.


Measurement - The project manager must monitor and measure the performance of the project to ensure that it is on track to meet its objectives.


Uncertainty - The project manager must identify and manage uncertainty to mitigate risk and ensure that the project is successful.


In the second part of the course, I will be joined by Roy Schilling, CSP, CSM, PMI-ACP to thoroughly analyze the PMBOK Guide Seventh Edition from an Agile, Hybrid and Predictive perspective. A great refresher for CAPM exam students taking the new 2023 CAPM Exam and PMP students alike.
target_audience: Anyone familiar with PMBOK 6th Edition looking to rapidly understand PMBOK 7th Edition

The course begins with an interesting introduction part which explains the importance of procurement management. Project procurement management is a process where an organization collaborates with external suppliers to obtain goods and services. These relationships are created based on a contract. The supplier supplies goods and services on time to the organization and meets the standard requested by the purchaser.
Procurement Management deals with getting work done by people who are external to the project team. Procurement management includes monitoring the contracts, change the control process to manage contracts or purchase orders.
Procurement management is a process where goods and services are obtained from different organization. courses.description:
Embark on a transformative journey led by Jamal, a seasoned project management consultant with over 25 years of experience, as he shares his wealth of knowledge in risk management planning. Benefit from his extensive expertise in conducting risk exercises on major projects, enabling you to navigate the complex landscape of project risks with confidence.
Begin with a comprehensive overview of the project manager's responsibilities and the pivotal role of the risk management plan within the broader project plan. Explore the fundamental concepts of project risk, emphasizing key approaches to risk management, including risk identification, risk assessment, risk responses (mitigation, acceptance, transference, and avoidance), and risk monitoring.
Delve into a wide range of potential risks that projects may encounter, such as budget/funding constraints, schedule uncertainties, scope changes, technical challenges, human resource issues, hardware limitations, contractual concerns, political influences, and business, legal, and environmental factors.
Explore various risk identification techniques, including brainstorming, Delphi and Nominal Group methods, as well as interviews and checklists. Gain insights into the domain of risk analysis, where qualitative techniques such as Probability Impact Matrix and Risk Ranking tables are employed. Additionally, delve into quantitative risk analysis methodologies, including the Three Point Estimate, Decision Tree Analysis, and Expected Monetary Value (EMV) approaches.
Furthermore, examine four traditional risk response mechanisms: mitigation, acceptance, transference, and avoidance. Understand the significance of each response strategy and learn how to apply them effectively based on the nature and severity of the identified risks.
Concluding the course, you will explore risk triggers—critical events or circumstances that may activate specific risks. Gain a deep understanding of how to identify and respond to these triggers, enhancing your ability to proactively manage risks throughout the project lifecycle.
Join Jamal on this enlightening journey and master the art of risk management planning. Enroll now and gain the skills needed to mitigate uncertainties, seize opportunities, and ensure project success.

How to prepare for the actual exam?

Attend a course from an Authorised Training Organisation OR Self-study with the official PRINCE2 Agile® Manual (for Foundation students, read the syllabus to know where to focus your efforts)
Take notes (writing strongly increases understanding and memory retention)
Test your learnings with practice exams like this (supplement your notes with learnings from mistakes)


How to purchase the exam voucher?
You can purchase the exam voucher via PeopleCert or via an Authorized Training Organization. All exam vouchers for PRINCE2 Agile® Foundation should come with the corresponding Manual (eBook), available online at PeopleCert.

Difficulty Level
As per the official Syllabus, the majority of our questions are categorised as Bloom's Level 2: Comprehension, requiring you to explain, describe, interpret, and distinguish between various aspects of PRINCE2 Agile®. This level of questioning aligns with the foundation-level exam's objective of evaluating your understanding of the methodology.
A smaller portion of our questions fall under Bloom's Level 1: Knowledge. These questions test your ability to recall key information, list essential points, identify central concepts, and outline processes crucial to the successful implementation of PRINCE2 Agile®.

Answer Feedback
Each question includes a clear explanation of the correct answer and insights into why other options are incorrect. This feedback loop enables you to learn from your mistakes, reinforce your understanding, and approach the actual exam with confidence.

Prepare for the exam
Take the first step towards PRINCE2 Agile® Foundation certification success with our tests. Start today, one practice exam at a time!

Unofficial Practice Exam Disclaimer
These practice questions are original content created specifically to help you prepare for your certification journey. They do not contain any copyrighted official exam questions, are independently produced, and are not affiliated with, endorsed, or approved by PeopleCert or AXELOS.
target_audience: Individuals preparing to take the official PRINCE2 Agile® Foundation examination and seeking realistic practice questions to assess their knowledge and exam readiness.

courses.description:
Welcome to your PMP Exam Preparation journey! The Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is one of the most prestigious credentials in the project management field. This course is designed to provide you with an elementary overview of the PMP exam and the skills you'll need to approach it with confidence. It's not a full 35-hour exam prep course, but rather an introduction to the fundamental basics, key concepts, and strategies for success.
In this course, you'll learn about the PMP exam content outline, as well as the PMBOK Guide Seventh edition and its 12 PM Principles and 8 Project Performance Domains. You'll also gain a solid understanding of the Agile Manifesto and its importance in project management and the exam. With this knowledge, you'll be well on your way to the PMP exam.
The course will also help you develop the right mindset for taking the PMP exam. Over the course of 3 hours you'll learn about the PMI/PMP exam mindset, the agile mindset, and the exam-taking mindset. These lessons will provide you with tips and tricks to approach the exam with confidence, so you can feel prepared on test day.
In addition to the PMP exam preparation content, the course also covers Professional Development Units (PDUs), which are needed for certification renewal. This is important because your PMP certificate expires every 3 years and you have to renew it. You'll learn how to earn PDUs and maintain your PMP certification, so you can stay up-to-date in the industry.
To make your PMP exam journey even more exciting, the course also includes videos with lessons learned from PMP professionals Dana Domnisor and Sudip Roy. They will share their experiences and best practices from taking the PMP exam, so you can learn from their success.
By taking this course, you'll have a solid understanding of the PMP exam and the skills you'll need to approach it.
Sign up now and start your PMP exam journey with confidence!

courses.title: PMP Certification Practice Exam
courses.bio: PMP Exam Simulator
courses.description:
A PMP certification mock exam course is designed to prepare students for the actual PMP exam by simulating exam-like conditions and providing practice questions like what they might encounter on the real exam. Preparing for the Project Management Professional (PMP) certification can be challenging, and many candidates encounter common pitfalls. Awareness of these pitfalls can help you avoid them and improve your chances of success. Here are some common pitfalls to watch out for:
· Underestimating the Exam: Some candidates underestimate the complexity and depth of the PMP exam. It is a comprehensive exam that requires a solid understanding of project management principles and processes. Failing to acknowledge the difficulty of the exam may lead to inadequate preparation.
· Overlooking Practice Exams: Practice exams are essential for evaluating your knowledge and understanding of the concepts. Some candidates neglect taking mock exams or practice questions, which can prevent them from identifying weak areas and improving their test-taking skills.
· Neglecting Time Management: Time management during the exam is critical. Some candidates spend too much time on individual questions, leaving them with insufficient time for other questions. Practising time management during mock exams can help address this issue.
This mock exam course may include practice tests and exercises that simulate the actual PMP exam, allowing students to assess their knowledge and readiness for the certification exam. Additionally, the course might guide test-taking strategies and tips for managing time effectively during the real exam.


learners can expect to achieve after completing the PMP certification exam simulator on the Udemy platform:

courses.description:
Six  Sigma Yellow Belt is the second level of Six Sigma certifications that provides a foundational understanding of the Six Sigma methodology. Yellow Belts are typically team members who work on projects led by higher-level Six Sigma professionals, such as Green Belts or Black Belts.
Welcome to Six Sigma Yellow Belt for Quality Healthcare! This course is specifically designed to cater to the unique challenges and intricacies of healthcare/hospital quality management/leadership.
Why do I need to learn Six Sigma?
Six Sigma is a data-driven methodology that aims to improve the quality of processes by minimizing variation and reducing defects or errors.
Improve Patient Safety: By implementing Six Sigma methodologies, healthcare organizations can identify and minimize errors to improve patient safety and reduce adverse events.
Enhance Efficiency: Six Sigma helps healthcare professionals identify and eliminate waste, streamline processes, and improve efficiency. This results in reduced patient waiting times, improved patient flow, and increased overall productivity.
Higher Quality of Care: By focusing on performance improvement and reducing variation, Six Sigma helps healthcare providers deliver high-quality and consistent care. This translates to better patient outcomes and increased patient satisfaction.
Cost Reduction: By eliminating defects and improving efficiency, Six Sigma can help healthcare organizations reduce costs associated with errors, rework, and inefficient processes. It also enables better resource allocation and optimization.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Six Sigma relies on data analysis to identify areas for improvement. By collecting and analyzing data, healthcare organizations gain valuable insights that can inform strategic decision-making and drive continuous improvement.
Why should I enroll in this course(Yellow Belt)?
Healthcare organizations are increasingly recognizing the importance of quality improvement and patient safety. By becoming proficient in Six Sigma, you will possess a valuable skill set that is in high demand within the healthcare industry.
Six Sigma Methodologies: This course will introduce you to the fundamental principles and concepts of Six Sigma, a data-driven approach aimed at improving processes and minimizing defects in various industries, including healthcare. You will learn about the DMAIC (Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve, Control) methodology and its application to healthcare settings.
Six Sigma Metrics: In this course, you will learn about various quality metrics, such as defect per unit (DPU), defect per million opportunities (DPMO), critical to quality (CTQ) parameters, and process capability indices. These metrics help measure and monitor performance and guide process improvement efforts in healthcare.
Team Basics: This course will cover the basics of building and managing teams in healthcare settings. You will learn about the team development process, team dynamics, decision-making tools, communication strategies, roles and responsibilities, and techniques for conflict resolution.
Lean Methodologies: This course will introduce you to key lean concepts and methodologies, such as value stream mapping, 5S, 8 wastes, just-in-time (JIT), pull system, poka-yoke, standard work, kanban, kaizen, and more. You will learn how lean principles can be applied to healthcare systems to optimize patient care and reduce unnecessary costs.

Udicine™ Society
シックスシグマ・イエローベルトは、シックスシグマ手法の基礎的な理解を提供するエントリーレベルの資格です。イエローベルトは通常、グリーンベルトやブラックベルトのような、より高いレベルのシックスシグマプロフェッショナルが率いるプロジェクトで働くチームメンバーです。
シックスシグマ・イエローベルトへようこそ： 質の高いヘルスケアへの最良のガイドです！このコースは、特にヘルスケア分野のユニークな課題と複雑さに対応するように設計されています。
なぜシックスシグマを学ぶ必要があるのか？
シックスシグマはデータ主導の方法論であり、ばらつきを最小限に抑え、欠陥やエラーを減らすことでプロセスの質を向上させることを目的としている。
患者の安全性の向上： シックスシグマの手法を導入することで、医療機関は患者の安全性を向上させ、有害事象を減らすためにエラーを特定し、最小限に抑えることができます。
効率性の向上： シックスシグマは、医療従事者が無駄を特定・排除し、プロセスを合理化し、効率を向上させるのに役立ちます。その結果、患者の待ち時間が短縮され、患者の流れが改善され、全体的な生産性が向上します。
ケアの質の向上: パフォーマンスの改善とばらつきの低減に焦点を当てることで、シックスシグマは医療従事者が高品質で一貫性のあるケアを提供できるよう支援します。これにより、患者の転帰が改善され、患者の満足度が向上します。
コスト削減： シックスシグマは、不良品を排除し、効率を改善することで、医療機関がエラー、手直し、非効率的なプロセスに関連するコストを削減するのに役立ちます。また、より良い資源配分と最適化を可能にします。
データ主導の意思決定： シックスシグマは、データ分析によって改善すべき領域を特定します。データを収集・分析することで、医療機関は戦略的な意思決定や継続的な改善の推進に役立つ貴重な洞察を得ることができます。
なぜこのコースを受講する必要があるのですか？
医療機関は、品質向上と患者安全の重要性をますます認識するようになっています。シックスシグマに精通することで、医療業界で需要の高い貴重なスキルを身につけることができます。
シックスシグマの方法論：このコースでは、医療を含む様々な業界において、プロセスを改善し、欠陥を最小限に抑えることを目的としたデータ主導のアプローチであるシックスシグマの基本原則とコンセプトを紹介します。DMAIC（Define、Measure、Analyze、Improve、Control）の方法論とその医療現場への応用について学びます。
シックスシグマの指標：このコースでは、DPU（Derfect Per Unit）、DPMO（Derfect Per Million Opportunities）、CTQ（Critical to Quality）パラメータ、プロセス能力指数など、さまざまな品質メトリクスについて学びます。これらのメトリクスは、ヘルスケアのパフォーマンスを測定・監視し、プロセス改善活動の指針となります。
チームの基本：このコースでは、医療現場におけるチーム作りとマネジメントの基本を学びます。チーム開発プロセス、チームダイナミクス、意思決定ツール、コミュニケーション戦略、役割と責任、対立解決のテクニックについて学びます。
リーン手法：このコースでは、バリューストリームマッピング、5S、8つのムダ、ジャストインタイム（JIT）、プルシステム、ポカヨケ、標準作業、カンバン、カイゼンなど、リーンの主要な概念と方法論を紹介します。リーンの原則を医療システムにどのように適用し、患者ケアを最適化し、不必要なコストを削減できるかを学びます。
統計: このコースを受講することで、医療の質向上における統計の概念とその応用について確かな理解を得ることができます。データの収集と分析、統計結果の解釈、そして患者ケアと業務効率を高めるためのデータ主導型の意思決定の方法を学びます。
データ分析：このコースでは、医療データを効果的に分析するために必要なスキルとツールを習得します。根本原因分析、プロセスマッピング、統計的プロセス制御など、様々なデータ分析テクニックを学び、医療機関における品質向上の機会を特定するのに役立ちます。
30日間返金保証！ このコースでは、30日間の返金保証を提供しています。何らかの理由でコースの内容や内容にご満足いただけない場合は、指定された期間内に返金を請求することができます。このコースは、あなたの明るい未来への切符となることでしょう。
このコースは、キャリアアップを目指す医療従事者の方にも、品質マネジメントの実践を強化したい組織の方にも、それぞれのニーズに合わせた内容となっています。
今すぐ登録! コースでお会いしましょう.

courses.description:
Financial Management for Non-Financial Project Managers
Master the financial skills every project manager needs to succeed—no accounting degree required!
Are you a project manager struggling to keep budgets on track, justify expenses, or boost profitability? "Financial Management for Non-Financial Project Managers" is your practical guide to mastering the financial side of projects. Designed for non-financial professionals, this course breaks down complex concepts into actionable steps, empowering you to take control of project finances with confidence.
What You’ll Learn:
Module 1: Grasp why financial oversight matters and learn key terms like revenue, costs, and CapEx vs. OpEx.
Module 2: Build accurate project budgets using techniques like bottom-up estimating and contingency planning.
Module 3: Master cost management with tools like Earned Value Management (EVM) and cost baselines.
Module 4: Decode project accounting, from financial statements to overhead allocation and risk mitigation.
Module 5: Prevent budget overruns with proven cost control and risk management strategies.
Module 6: Protect project margins by tackling scope creep, poor tracking, and resource inefficiencies.
Module 7: Make data-driven decisions using ROI, NPV, and cost-benefit analysis, plus communicate financials to stakeholders.
Module 8: Forecast costs accurately to ensure long-term project success.
Why Take This Course?
Through hands-on exercises, case studies, and real-world applications, you’ll learn to manage budgets, track expenses, improve profitability, and present financial data like a pro. Whether you’re managing small teams or large-scale projects, this course equips you with the tools to deliver results without financial surprises.
Who This Course Is For:
Project managers seeking financial literacy
Team leads transitioning to project oversight
Professionals managing budgets without a finance background
Enroll Now!
Gain the skills to align project goals with financial success. Complete the course quiz, earn your certificate, and step into your next project with financial expertise that sets you apart!
target_audience: Non-Financial Project Managers: Ideal for project managers who lack a finance background but need to handle budgets and financial decisions.

courses.description:
Welcome to Managing the Development of New Products. I’m Eric Heilmann, and I’ve been leading new product development programs for over 20 years at various companies in the tech industry. I have found this field of program and project management very rewarding, and I’m excited to have the opportunity to share what I’ve learned with you.
The objective of new product development is to enable the sales, delivery and support of products and services. The goal of course is to provide customers with value while meeting the business needs of your company.
In this course, I will be covering a lot of familiar concepts and techniques that are part of general project management. However, in the context of new product development, some of these techniques take on more significance than others. For example, interfaces to product management, business development, and customer support are critical to defining and validating the product before releasing it to mass production.
As a new product development program manager, you are not just responsible for delivering a product on time and under budget, but also for making sure that planning and execution of the entire new product introduction is carried out successfully. No matter what industry you are in, technology and globalization will continue to increase competitive pressure, making the successful development and launch of new products even more critical to the health and survival of your company.
target_audience: Project managers who want to learn tools to manage the development of new products.

courses.title: Gain a working knowledge of Project Human Resource
courses.bio: Apply project human resources management approaches

requirements: No prior knowledge is required, Project Management Fundamentals is recommended
courses.description:
Projects are the way of doing business and organisations need skilled people who can manage them and operate effectively in a project environment.  As more organisations adopt Project Management as the tool for the implementation of work, these skills are becoming ever so in demand.
Understand and Apply Human Resource Management.
This program has been drawn from International Project Management Best Practice and developed to meet the requirements of the relevant unit of competence within Nationally Recognised Certificate IV in Project Management Practice in Australia.
This course is delivered in a practical real world context and whilst it is supported by theory it focuses on delivering the practical skills you can apply directly to your projects.
If you are managing projects, working in a project team or affected by projects in one way or another this course is for you.  You will gain a practical insight into scope management exploring the following:
Introduction into Human Resource Management:
What is Human Resources
The legislation
Typical roles and Governance
Methods to engage personell
How to determine Project Human Resource requirements
How to staff a project
Use the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS)
Analyse task skills
Use the Responsibility Assignment Matrix (RAM)
How to Develop Effective Teams
Discover what motivates your team
How to foster collaboration
Setting a great culture
How to Monitor effective Human Resource Management
How develop methods to monitor roles and responsibilities
Understand Human Performance
Understand coaching, mentoring and training
Monitor and Track metrics such as effort
How to manage conflict
How to Evaluate Human Resource Management
How to review the effectiveness of Human Resources
Understand the 360 degree feedback tool
Conduct lessons learned
At the end of this program you will have a practical, working understanding of how to manage the Human resources of the Project.  By completing the activities, you will have met most of the requirements of the Nationally Recognised unit: Apply project human resources management approaches  (BSBPMG413) as part of the Certificate IV in Project Management.
The reason for developing the course
I found that the resources provided to many students undertaking studies in Project Management were lacking.  They were either;
too theoretical, which prevented students applying it to their workplaces;
not engaging, such as books or PDFs;
hard to understand: using complex language to illustrate otherwise simple concepts; or
incorrect, usually written by people without a true and practical understanding of the subject.
Online learning is difficult- I know, I am the worst online student.  As a result, I have designed this course to provide students with an additional resource to enhance their understanding of the topic.  The course is based upon strong theoretical foundations, but delivered in a practical way- so you can apply what you learn to better your projects.
I have also tried to make the course engaging using a mix of visual and auditory delivery accompanied by tasks which you can use to test your knowledge and apply the concepts.  I have also tried to approach the subject in a casual way, which will hopefully make it a fun learning experience.
I have tried to keep the language to its simplest form, explaining industry words as I progress through the course.  This will enable you to understand the vocabulary used in Project Management, without being confused by it.
target_audience: This course has been designed for those; new to project management, working in project teams or a project environment or managing small to medium scaled projects. This course is highly recommended for anyone studying the Certificate IV in Project Management Practice (BSB41515)

courses.description:
Project Management Bootcamp 5.0 is a cutting-edge program designed to equip professionals with the strategic, technical, and analytical skills needed to lead and deliver high-impact projects in today's complex environments. This advanced-level course bridges the gap between traditional project management principles and the transformative capabilities of digital and AI-driven tools. Participants will master best practices from PMBOK and PRINCE2, while also exploring the nuances of agile, hybrid, and scaled frameworks like SAFe for managing dynamic, modern project lifecycles.
The course emphasizes real-world application through advanced case studies, simulations, and AI-based tools for planning, resource management, and risk prediction. Learners will gain hands-on experience with data visualization platforms like Power BI and Tableau, machine learning applications for milestone forecasting, and AI-enhanced communication systems to improve stakeholder engagement. Ethical considerations, cybersecurity, and regulatory compliance in AI-powered projects are also critically examined.
By the end of this bootcamp, participants will be empowered to lead high-performing teams, implement intelligent decision-making processes, and adopt future-ready innovations such as blockchain, digital twins, and quantum project management. Ideal for mid-to-senior level professionals, consultants, and PMO leaders, this course offers a transformative learning experience to future-proof your project management career in the digital and AI era.
In this bootcamp, I would like to teach the major topics:
Strategic Foundations of Project Management

courses.title: Comprehensive Agile Project Management and Scrum Master
courses.bio: Mastering Agile Project Management, Scrum Framework, and Product Management Integration
objectives: The fundamental differences between Waterfall and Agile methodologies, focusing on incremental delivery and Minimum Viable Product (MVP) development.
The concept and significance of the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) in Agile development, including its definition and how it drives product development.
The Agile Manifesto: its principles, core values, and how they shape successful software development projects.
The roles, workflow, and key concepts of Scrum, a widely used Agile framework.
The fundamental principles of Scrum, including its artifacts, events, and roles, and how they contribute to Agile project success.
How to effectively implement and navigate the Scrum framework, ensuring transparency, efficiency, and value delivery.
The key accountabilities and dynamics of the Scrum team, including the responsibilities of developers, product owners, and Scrum Masters.

An in-depth understanding of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and its application in Agile product management and development.
How to integrate the Business Model Canvas with Agile Scrum and product management practices to drive strategic decision-making and innovation.
Crafting a compelling Product Vision Board and understanding its key elements to align teams and stakeholders towards a common goal.
Practical insights and case studies, including a detailed analysis of Uber & Netflix's business model using the Business Model Canvas framework.
requirements: Basic understanding of project management concepts: While not mandatory, having some familiarity with project management principles will be beneficial for grasping Agile methodologies more effectively.

Familiarity with software development processes: A basic understanding of software development processes and terminology will help students better understand the context and application of Agile methodologies in software development projects.
courses.description:
Welcome to "Comprehensive Agile Project Management and Scrum Master"! This comprehensive course is designed to equip you with the essential skills and knowledge needed to thrive in today's dynamic project management landscape.


In this course, you'll embark on a journey through the core principles and practices of agile project management, exploring how it revolutionizes traditional approaches like Waterfall methodology. You'll delve into the concept of the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) in Agile Development, understanding its significance in delivering value to stakeholders while minimizing waste and maximizing efficiency.


Unveiling the Agile Manifesto, you'll uncover the guiding values and principles that underpin successful software development initiatives, emphasizing collaboration, adaptability, and customer-centricity. You'll navigate the Scrum landscape, mastering its fundamental concepts, roles, and workflow, and gaining insights into the key accountabilities and dynamics of Scrum teams.


As you progress, you'll explore the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), gaining a comprehensive overview of its key principles and practices. You'll learn how to implement the Scrum framework within SAFe, navigate agile teams' roles, structures, and dynamics, and understand the crucial responsibilities of Scrum Masters, Product Owners, and product management in driving agile excellence.


Moreover, you'll delve into crafting compelling product visions using the Business Model Canvas, integrating it seamlessly with Agile Scrum and product management practices. Through real-world case studies and practical examples, such as Netflix and Uber, you'll decode the Business Model Canvas and uncover its transformative potential in driving innovation and success.


By the end of this course, you'll emerge as a proficient agile project manager, equipped with the skills and insights needed to lead successful projects, foster collaboration, and deliver value in today's fast-paced, ever-changing business landscape. Whether you're a seasoned project manager or new to the field, this course will empower you to excel in Agile project management, Scrum framework implementation, and product management integration.
target_audience: Project Managers: Project managers seeking to transition from traditional waterfall methodologies to Agile practices or enhance their Agile project management skills.

Software Developers and Engineers: Software developers and engineers who want to learn how to work in Agile teams, deliver high-quality software products iteratively, and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Product Managers: Product managers looking to deepen their understanding of Agile principles and practices, especially in the context of product development and management.

Team Leaders and Scrum Masters: Team leaders, Scrum Masters, and Agile coaches aiming to improve their leadership skills, facilitate Agile ceremonies, and foster a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement within their teams.
Business Analysts: Business analysts interested in understanding how Agile methodologies can improve requirements gathering, user story writing, and product delivery processes.

Entrepreneurs and Startup Founders: Entrepreneurs and startup founders seeking to leverage Agile and Scrum methodologies to build and launch Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) efficiently and iteratively.

requirements: You'll need basic PC skills in office products

courses.description:
If you're managing projects in a small or medium business, then this course is for you.  You might be a one person business who has outsourced an important piece of work to a contractor and wants to make sure that it's managed well or in a company with multi-million dollars of revenue and lots of projects going on.
We're not going to swamp you with endless drivel and esoteric project management concepts. This course is designed to be succinct and to the point and provides tons of support material - 65 items - to provide you with the means to start managing projects now, rather than trying to remember what was said in lecture 20 of a 14 hour course.
So why do you need this course? For a large organisation a project disaster is unlikely to have a significant impact on their bottom line.  For smaller companies however a project that costs significantly more than budgeted or takes much longer to deliver can result in a crisis.
Smaller companies don't need the huge overheads and mountains of paperwork implied big company methods like PMP and Prince 2 to run successful projects, but they do need sufficient rigour and process to assure on time and budget delivery.  This course delivers an out of the box, practical, tried and trusted method for project delivery integrated with project templates together with heaps of tips that will allow project managers in smaller enterprises to hit the ground running from day 1.
target_audience: This course is aimed at managers running projects in smaller enterprises
You might be a one person business who has outsourced a piece of work to a contractor and wants to manage that well
Or in a company with multi-million dollars of revenue and lots of projects going on
Or you might be an 'accidental project manager' i.e. someone whose job title isn't project manager but who is involved in project management work
It is not aimed at project managers in companies with multi-billion dollar turnover with huge teams of project managers and support staff

courses.description:
In today's fast-paced work environment, effective project management is crucial for success. Trello, a versatile and user-friendly tool, has become a favorite among professionals for organizing tasks and collaborating with teams. This comprehensive course is designed to take you from a Trello novice to a proficient user, capable of managing complex projects with ease.
We begin with an introduction to Trello, exploring its key benefits and providing a step-by-step guide to setting up your account. You'll learn how to create boards, organize lists by workflow stages, and break down tasks using customizable cards. Adding team members and setting due dates will become second nature as you master the essentials of task management.
Collaboration is at the heart of Trello. You'll discover how to use comments, discussions, and @mentions to improve team communication. We'll also delve into Power-Ups, such as integrating Google Drive for seamless file sharing and connecting Trello to Slack for streamlined notifications.
Advanced features like automating workflows with Butler, using filters to focus on specific tasks, and managing task dependencies will be covered in detail. Time management techniques, including creating milestones and integrating time-tracking tools, will help you stay on schedule.
Monitoring project progress is essential. You'll learn to track task completion with checklists, use Gantt charts for visualizing timelines, and generate reports for detailed insights. Customizing Trello to fit your workflow, from designing templates to personalizing boards, will ensure the tool works for you.
By the end of this course, you'll have a thorough understanding of Trello's capabilities and be equipped with the skills to manage projects efficiently, collaborate effectively with your team, and customize the platform to suit your unique needs.

requirements: No scheduling experience required! This course starts from the very beginning and takes you step by step to learn how to schedule like a pro. You will need a computer or phone to create your own schedule!
courses.description:
This class teaches you how to build a schedule from scratch using Google Sheets! You can start with no experience as a beginner and end with a working knowledge of Google Sheets and scheduling. We will build a Gantt chart-style schedule from start to finish so you will end the course with a schedule of your own to track your current project. (Or a theoretical one that you WANT to track!) The existing online courses on scheduling are typically dry, slow, and are not suited for beginners. This course changes that!
Brendan has used this kind of schedule to track dozens of commercial construction projects over the last 10 years of his career. This is the class he wishes he had back in 2014 when re-entering the construction field. It shares the foundational elements of the tools and techniques to build an effective and clear schedule as quickly as possible. A detailed and clear schedule increases the speed of any project and helps everyone involved to be efficient and come away satisfied.
In this class you'll learn:
How to get access to Google Sheets for free
How to set up and build a schedule
How to actually plan activities in order and organize them correctly in a Gantt chart style.
Formatting techniques for giving plenty of info without adding visual clutter
How to edit and change your schedule when the ideal plans don’t work out! (This always happens!)
You’ll be creating:
A custom schedule to track your own project accurately and simply.
Why make a schedule?
Scheduling keeps your project on track whether that’s a $3 million construction project or a plan to clean out the garage over spring break this year. Anything that has more than 10 steps to it and relies on one action following another step by step deserves a proper schedule to have high quality and the fastest possible finishing date! So why are we using Google Sheets and not a fancy, purpose-built scheduling program?
Why Google Sheets?
Google Sheets is an incredible way to make a schedule. After using 5 different dedicated programs for scheduling, Brendan has circled back to the simplicity and ease of Google Sheets for his professional work. Here’s why:
It’s free
It’s faster than other programs
It’s simple for other people to pick up and interpret
It’s highly customizable
It’s perfectly integrated to mobile devices like phones and tablets
It speaks a common language of the business word which is: the language of spreadsheet
Exports to excel well if you need that option
It is effective in practice
Do I need to be a spreadsheet expert to do this?
No! This course is built for anyone who wants to learn how to build a schedule and teaches everything you need to know to get started, even if you’ve never used a spreadsheet before!
Let’s get started!
target_audience: For anyone who needs to learn to schedule using a Gantt chart style.
For someone planning a detailed activity with more than 20 steps
For someone in the construction industry needing to plan a project
For someone in the software industry planning a sequence of work with many steps

courses.description:
understanding the intricate dynamics of organizational influences and mastering the project management lifecycle are crucial skills for any aspiring leader or manager. This comprehensive course is meticulously designed to equip you with the knowledge and tools necessary to navigate the complexities of organizational behavior and excel in every phase of project management. Whether you are a seasoned professional looking to enhance your skill set or a burgeoning talent eager to make your mark, this course promises to be a transformative journey toward career success.

Imagine being able to seamlessly integrate into any organization, understanding its unique culture, structure, and politics, and leveraging this knowledge to drive projects to successful completion. This course offers you that ability. Through a blend of theoretical insights and practical applications, you will delve into the subtle yet powerful forces that shape organizational behavior. You will explore how leadership styles, communication patterns, and decision-making processes impact the overall functioning of an organization. By gaining a deeper understanding of these elements, you will be better positioned to influence outcomes, foster collaboration, and create an environment conducive to achieving strategic objectives.

Transitioning from organizational dynamics, the course takes you on an in-depth exploration of the project management lifecycle. You will be introduced to the fundamental principles and methodologies that underpin successful project management. From initiation and planning to execution, monitoring, and closure, each phase of the project lifecycle will be dissected and analyzed. You will learn how to define project scope, develop detailed project plans, allocate resources efficiently, and set realistic timelines. The course emphasizes the importance of adaptability and resilience, teaching you how to anticipate challenges, manage risks, and mitigate potential issues before they escalate.

One of the unique features of this course is its emphasis on real-world applicability. The curriculum is enriched with case studies, simulations, and hands-on exercises that mirror the complexities and unpredictability of actual projects. By engaging with these practical scenarios, you will develop the critical thinking and problem-solving skills essential for managing projects in diverse settings. The course also integrates the latest tools and technologies used in project management, ensuring that you stay abreast of industry trends and best practices.

This course is designed with a strong focus on personal and professional development. It recognizes that mastering organizational influences and the project management lifecycle is not just about acquiring technical skills; it is also about cultivating the right mindset and attitudes. You will be encouraged to engage in self-reflection, assess your strengths and areas for improvement, and develop a personalized growth plan. The course also offers opportunities for networking and collaboration with peers, fostering a community of like-minded professionals who can support and inspire each other.

By the end of this course, you will emerge with a comprehensive understanding of how to navigate organizational dynamics and manage projects from inception to completion. You will be equipped with a robust toolkit of skills and strategies that you can apply immediately in your professional life. Whether you aim to lead complex projects, drive organizational change, or enhance your managerial capabilities, this course will provide you with the foundation you need to excel.

But the impact of this course extends beyond individual career success. Organizations today are in dire need of professionals who can bridge the gap between strategic vision and operational execution. By mastering organizational influences and the project management lifecycle, you will be positioned to take on roles that are critical to your organization's success. You will be able to lead teams with confidence, manage resources effectively, and deliver projects that align with organizational goals. This, in turn, will enhance your value to your organization and open up new avenues for career advancement.

This course offers a unique and comprehensive approach to mastering the interplay between organizational dynamics and project management. It is designed to be engaging, informative, and transformative, providing you with the skills and knowledge necessary to excel in today's competitive business environment. By enrolling in this course, you are making a commitment to your personal and professional growth, positioning yourself for success in any organizational setting. We invite you to take this exciting step towards mastering organizational influences and the project management lifecycle, and we look forward to supporting you on your journey to career excellence.

courses.title: Quantitative Risk Analysis for Projects on Excel
courses.bio: Quantifying project risks with Monte Carlo simulation using Excel-based free software
objectives: How to build, run and interpret a Monte Carlo simulation analysis of the risks of a project.

Project risk methodologies: Why Qualitative Risk Heat Maps Are Useless
Introduction to Monte Carlo Simulation with Excel
Interpretation of results: Interpreting the First Level Graphs: Histograms
Interpreting Third Level Graphs: Scatter Plots
Appendix - How many iterations to run on a simulation

requirements: Basic knowledge of Excel
courses.description:
Learning how to quantify risks using a simple template on top of Excel.
After having discarded heat maps as a weak and unjustifiable “methodology” for risk analysis, we present quantitative risk analysis for projects. Easy, intuitive and free. It can easily be done on top of Excel with macro-based software to perform Monte Carlo simulation. Simply go to dtsimulator dot com and download a free template that allows you to perform simulation without having to purchase expensive software. List your project risks on a register. As in qualitative risk analysis, you add 2 dimensions to each risk line: frequency and severity. We teach you how to add expert’s opinion, adding distribution functions to both frequency and severity of possible risk events. You are ready to perform a Monte Carlo simulation: a mathematical method on top of Excel that generates random values along the distributions of your risks. With thousands of repetitions or scenarios, DTSimulator generates datasets from which graphs summarize the outcomes of your analysis. We will teach you how to analyze histograms, tornado charts, S curves and scatter plots to get the most out of a quantitative project risk analysis. Go to dtsimulator dot com and download macro-based risk templates to start quantifying the risks on your project.
target_audience: Project managers, risk analysts, project risk professionals

courses.description:
Udemy PMP Exam practice tests courses


Are you ready to take your Project Management Professional (PMP) certification exam? If so, our exclusive PMP Exam Prep course is just what you need! This Udemy course offers detailed explanations and practice tests based on the most updated version of the PMBOK Guide (7th edition), as well as many call outs from PMBOK 6th edition and 6 other PMI exam textbooks. Aspirants will be able to gain a better understanding of each knowledge area with exam questions that are similar to the real exam and two mock tests that are situationally based.


My PMP experience
Unlike some of the exams you’ve found on Udemy or online, I recently passed the PMP on my first try in mid-2023, with above target in all categories. You can look me up in the PMI registry, visit my LinkedIn or PMP review on my website for more information.
I also passed my PMI-ACP a few years ago with above target in all categories, so I understand the structure of the agile questions from the PMI. I have also practically used agile for the last 8+ years of experience in running agile teams in tech.
Note:
On my website (Yourdigitalaid) I have reviews of both my taking and passing the PMP and PMI-ACP. You can read more there for free!
The purpose of me creating this Udemy course was to create an exam simulator with realistic PMP questions of someone that actually wrote the exam recently and understand the examination content outline which has completely change the structure of the PMP.
I personally also struggled with finding a cheap set of high quality PMP exam questions which was off-putting and discouraging.


Each practice exam includes 180 questions covering the following:
All of the exam content outlines (ECOs)
All five process groups
Predictive, Hybrid and Agile related questions (especially scrum).
Questions covering business environment, people and process
A clear walkthrough on why each the rationale for the correct answer and the corresponding references to the PMIs documentation.
Many of the questions are situational based, and don’t have a direct answer available in the references, but most be deduced.


When taking these exams
To ensure success in passing the these practice exams and even the PMP certification exam, analyze the questions slowly and re-read the answers. If you get the wrong answer, understand why the answer is wrong and the review the references I left.
With a total duration of four hours for each of our PMP practice tests, we try to replicate the real exam, and come with questions that relate to the PMBOK, Agile practice guide and many of the other reading materials.


Refer to the PMP ECO (examination content outline) for the specific tasks. Each of the tasks labelled at the bottom of each answer / question, will tell you how each question relates to the actual exam.


Domain I - People
Domain II - Process
Domain III - Business environment


Note: I wish I could add all of the tasks, but Udemy seems to have a limit on how many knowledge areas you're allowed to have. I also can't choose more than one, so take the knowledge areas in Udemy for what they're worth.


Further training and support
If you’re looking for more support to pass the PMP outside of the educator support offered by Udemy - if you buy the course, I will set-up a 30 minute office hours (VIA Adplist) with you to help chat through any issues you may be have with studying or provide you with guidance on mock exams and exam sets offer by me. I can also point you in the right direction on where to get the resources below.


References I used at the end of almost all the practice questions:
PMBOK Guide Sixth edition
PMBOK Guide Seventh edition
Agile practice guide
Effective Project Management - Traditional Agile, Extreme (7th edition)
Essential Scrum: A Practical Guide to the Most Popular Agile Process
Project Management: The Managerial Process (4th and 7th edition)
Project Management: A Systems Approach to Planning, Scheduling, and Controlling 10th edition
Information Technology Project Management 8th Edition

When going through the questions, reference these documents at the end of each question.

courses.title: Backlog Grooming for Agile Requirements
courses.bio: Learn how to refine requirements for Agile projects
objectives: How backlog grooming works
The difference between coarse-grained and fine-grained requirements
How to start grooming backlogs on their projects right away

What is Backlog Grooming?: Backlog Grooming Process: User Story Breakdown Exercise

requirements: some understanding of Agile
courses.description:
Have you or your Agile teams had trouble refining requirements on an Agile project? Are your teams struggling with user stories and tasks that are too large for them to handle well? If so, you and your teams need more guidance to implement backlog / user story grooming.
Backlog grooming is a step-by-step process of taking high-level (“coarse-grained”) requirements and refining them to lower-level user stories and tasks (“fine-grained”) that are ready to put into a sprint. Backlog grooming is typically a product owner role that requires skill in prioritizing requirements and breaking down requirements with the help of the customer and development team.
In this course, attendees will learn how to work the process to achieve fine-grained requirements that are ready just in time. The key to success is leveraging tools and techniques as well as the expertise of your team to refine requirements iteratively.
After completing the course, attendees will be able to
Explain how backlog grooming works.
Understand the difference between coarse-grained and fine-grained requirements.
Start grooming backlogs on their projects right away.
target_audience: project and program managers and business analysts who are looking for ways to strengthen business requirements gathering techniques and improve project delivery outcomes
