courses.description:
IMPORTANT NOTE BEFORE YOU REGISTER: this course was created for people who want to learn how to organize all the necessary planning information for a website project before they interview / hire a website designer or a developer. This course is NOT for a web designer, web project manager, web developer, agency owner or someone in digital marketing wanting to learn about website planning for their clients' websites.


--------------------------------------


Whether you’ve hired a web developer before or you’re gearing up for your first project, we’ve all had the exact same thoughts cross our minds…


✓ I don’t even know what I want for my website.
✓ How do I communicate what I want to a developer so they actually get it right?
✓ I’m worried they will take advantage of me because I don’t know enough.
✓ What if the project ends up way more expensive than my quote?
✓ I’m afraid I won’t understand anything my web developer says to me.


The good news is that you’re not alone. And I’m here to help you leave these fears in the dust once and for all.


Hey there, I’m Natasha!


As the founder of On Purpose Projects, a web design/development team that has created hundreds of websites, I’ve seen every high and low in the book…


...and I’ve been through them myself!


As an ‘accidental’ founder of a web agency, and with zero technical knowledge at all, I had no idea how the website creation process was supposed to go to achieve the results I wanted…


… and I ended up losing tens of thousands of my own money on my website projects.


For years I struggled to run website projects properly….
… I had no idea what questions to ask when hiring someone to do the work…
… I didn’t know how to communicate exactly what I wanted so they could provide an accurate quote…
… I was constantly stressed out and worried I was sinking all my money into a project that wouldn’t even turn out the way I wanted.


But when I finally stopped and took the time to figure out why my projects weren’t successful, I worked out exactly what was required to make every single project run smoothly, stay on time, and be on budget.


I discovered that I:


✓ Didn’t have a game plan
✓ Hired the wrong person
✓ Did not communicate my expectations clearly


That’s why I created this course.


I want to remove all the guesswork from the website creation process so you can have the confidence to get exactly what you need without the endless stress and headaches.


Imagine…


✓ no more miscommunications
✓ no technical surprises
✓ no missed deadlines
✓ no unexpected invoices
✓ the right expert to help accomplish your goals
✓ no more sleepless nights and daily headaches




All of this is totally possible for you, you just need the right plan.




3 reasons why most website projects end in frustration and disappointment.


1. You have no game plan.
Websites may seem simple on the surface, but in reality there are so many layers and moving parts to the project.


Web developers may be experts, but they can’t read your mind. If you don’t know exactly what you want your website to look like and do, it’s impossible for them to meet your goals.


This course will give you a step-by-step game plan for preparing for your website project, so you’ll never have to guess at any part of your website again.




2. You hire the wrong person.
Websites are complicated, I get it! And it’s tempting to want to rely on the experts to tell you what you need to and who can help you accomplish it.


But if you’re not clear on what your ideal website looks like and does, chances are you’ll hire the wrong person and waste time (and money) on expensive mistakes and website do-overs.


This course is going to dig into exactly what different web experts can do so you can make an informed choice about the type of professional that’s the right fit for your needs.




3. You don’t clearly communicate your expectations.
It can be terrifying to hand off your website to a professional and trust that they do exactly what you need them to do. You end up feeling helpless and frustrated when things don’t go to plan, and you’re left correcting them over and over again until eventually you just want to give up and start again with someone else.


I’m going to show you how to communicate your expectations and feedback with your website developer so you are both on the same page every step of the way. You’ll be empowered to avoid every misunderstanding and miscommunication that hinders so many other business owners.




Your stress-free website plan starts now.


Ever heard the phrase “measure three times, cut once”?


That’s exactly what this course is going to help you do. We’re going to put all the work in at the front end so you get exactly what you need without expensive re-dos (and all the frustration that comes along with it).


Even if you aren’t tech savvy…
… even if you have that creative brain that struggles to plan…
… even if you don’t know the first thing about websites…


You have the ability to create an effective website plan. All you need is a nudge in the right direction.


Let’s get started!

courses.description:
Agile Project Management has revolutionized the way organizations approach project delivery, offering a framework for achieving flexibility, speed, and customer satisfaction in a rapidly changing business environment. This comprehensive course is designed to equip participants with the knowledge, skills, and tools necessary to effectively manage projects using Agile methodologies.
This course provides an in-depth exploration into Agile Project Management, a contemporary approach to project management that prioritizes flexibility and collaboration. Traditionally, many projects followed a linear, fixed-path progression, but in today's fast-paced digital age, businesses require a more adaptive and responsive methodology. Enter Agile. By embracing change as a constant, Agile Project Management allows for dynamic adaptations, ensuring that the end product is both relevant and of high quality.
The Agile approach is grounded in a set of guiding principles that emphasize customer collaboration, responding to change, and delivering functional products incrementally. Within this module, participants will delve into the twelve principles of the Agile Manifesto, understanding its philosophy and values. Furthermore, learners will be introduced to popular Agile frameworks such as Scrum, Kanban, and Lean. Each of these methodologies offers distinct tools and techniques for handling projects, and this course provides hands-on experience with each, helping students discern the best approach for different project types.
A critical component of Agile Project Management is the range of tools and techniques available to manage and track progress. In this segment, students will learn about user stories, backlogs, sprint planning, retrospectives, and daily stand-ups, among others. Beyond the mechanics, it's vital to understand the human side of Agile. As such, this course delves into the various roles involved in an Agile team - from the Scrum Master and Product Owner to the Development Team - shedding light on the responsibilities and interactions that drive Agile projects forward.
Through a blend of theoretical insights and practical applications, participants will explore the principles and values of Agile, the key frameworks (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, and Lean), and the best practices for implementing Agile in diverse industries. The course also emphasizes collaboration, iterative development, and adaptability to deliver high-quality results.
By the end of this online course, learners will not only grasp the foundational concepts of Agile but will also be equipped with the tools and knowledge to implement Agile practices effectively in their respective domains.
target_audience: Project managers looking to transition to Agile methodologies
Software developers and IT professionals
Product owners, Scrum Masters, and Agile coaches
Business analysts and consultants
Team leaders and managers
Any professional interested in modern project management techniques

Practical application of change management tools to overcome barriers to healthcare projects
requirements: Passion for leading successful change initiatives at healthcare organizations!
courses.description:
This course is designed for healthcare project managers (PMs) or clinical project leads with limited formal background in change management fundamentals. Throughout the course modules, you will receive an introduction to how people navigate change and an introduction to the change management process by reviewing some popular theories and models of change. We will also cover an overview of the life cycle of a project. Finally we’ll combine both change management principles and the project life cycle by reviewing some common barriers to change in healthcare projects throughout each stage of the project life cycle and allow time to apply the change management principles you just learned to each.
As a physical therapist, I was tasked with managing projects that required behavioral change, but I had no formal knowledge of change management theories, models, or tools to help manage that process. If a goal of our projects is to improve adoption of a new organization initiative, especially ones that involve workflow changes or practice changes, change management is an integral piece to ensuring that our projects are a success!
The goal of this course is to provide you with lessons learned, 'what I wish I had knowns', and basic tools to set you up for successfully implementing change at your organizations!
Let the journey begin!
CONTINUING EDUCATION NOTES:
PMP(R) Certificate Holders: This course content is appropriate to be self-logged for 0.5 PDU in Power Skills under the Education category. Nothing will be automatically added to your Dashboard after taking this course. You will have to manually log into your PMI(R) account and self-enter the PDUs in your Dashboard. Please message me with any questions on how to log your PDUs.
Physical Therapists/PTAs: For the year 2025 - This course is approved for 1 continuing education credit by the West Virginia Board of Physical Therapy (WVBOPT) for physical therapists and physical therapy assistants in the United States. Please message me for details on obtaining the appropriate course certificate if this applies to you. (Note: Credit can only be awarded to each participant one time, as it is the same course being presented in multiple packages. Message me with any questions. Participants licensed in other states are responsible for checking if their state of licensure will accept the WVBOPT approval) Thank you!

Learn How to Lead Projects with Confidence, Clarity, and Results!
Are you ready to develop the skills and confidence to manage projects of any size in any industry? Whether you’re stepping into your first project or want to sharpen your leadership abilities, this comprehensive course is designed to give you the real-world tools, strategies, and insight needed to deliver successful projects—every time.
This Project Management course is your complete guide to understanding how projects work, how to lead them effectively, and how to avoid common mistakes. From initiation to closing, you’ll walk through each phase of the project lifecycle and gain the practical skills needed to plan, execute, and manage projects with professionalism and impact.

courses.description:
You’re in the middle of a critical project, and everything seems to be going smoothly. Suddenly, you receive news that a key supplier has gone bankrupt. The timeline is now in jeopardy, costs are spiraling out of control, and your team is looking to you for answers. This isn’t a hypothetical scenario; it’s the reality many project managers face. Now, imagine you have the skills and knowledge to anticipate such risks, devise effective contingency plans, and navigate your project to success regardless of the obstacles. This is where our course, “Master PMP Risk Management: Comprehensive PMBoK Guide,” comes in.
Transform Your Project Management Skills
Welcome to a comprehensive journey designed to transform your project management skills by mastering risk management. This course isn’t just another online class; it’s a strategic investment in your professional future. With a focus on real-world application, our curriculum is crafted to help you identify, analyze, and mitigate risks effectively, ensuring your projects are successful, on time, and within budget.
What Makes This Course Unique?
1. Real-World Scenarios: Our course starts with real-world scenarios that put you in the shoes of a project manager facing high-stakes risks. These scenarios are designed to be both challenging and educational, providing you with practical insights into handling complex risk situations.
2. Comprehensive Curriculum: We cover every aspect of project risk management as outlined in the PMBoK guide. From the basics of risk identification to advanced quantitative analysis and risk response strategies, you’ll gain a thorough understanding of the entire risk management process.
3. Expert Instruction: Led by Peter Alkema, a seasoned project management professional, this course offers you the benefit of his extensive experience and insights. Peter’s practical approach to teaching will help you connect theoretical concepts with real-world applications.
4. Interactive Learning: Engage with a variety of learning materials, including video lectures, quizzes, and practical exercises. Our interactive approach ensures that you not only learn but also apply what you’ve learned to real-life situations.
What You Will Learn
• Risk Identification Techniques: Learn how to systematically identify potential risks using techniques like brainstorming, SWOT analysis, and expert judgment.
• Qualitative and Quantitative Risk Analysis: Master the skills to assess the likelihood and impact of risks, prioritize them, and perform numerical evaluations to understand their potential effects on project objectives.
• Effective Risk Response Strategies: Discover how to develop and implement proactive strategies to address risks, including mitigation, transfer, acceptance, and avoidance.
• Continuous Risk Monitoring: Understand how to monitor identified risks throughout the project lifecycle and make adjustments as needed to stay on track.
Course Features
• 8 Hours of On-Demand Video: Flexible learning at your own pace.
• Mobile and TV Access: Study on the go, anytime, anywhere.
• Full Lifetime Access: Revisit and refresh your knowledge whenever you need.
• Quizzes and Practical Exercises: Reinforce your learning and ensure you’re ready to apply your new skills.
Who Should Enroll?
• Project Managers: Enhance your risk management capabilities to lead successful projects.
• Aspiring Project Managers: Build a strong foundation in risk management to transition into project management roles.
• Team Members: Understand and contribute to risk management within your project teams.
• Business Analysts: Learn how risks can impact project outcomes and how to manage them effectively.
• Risk Management Professionals: Deepen your knowledge and apply PMBoK methodologies in your work.
• PMO Members: Support project managers and teams in implementing consistent risk management practices.
target_audience: Individuals responsible for planning, executing, and closing projects, who need to enhance their risk management skills to ensure project success.

courses.title: Logframe tool for efficient project planning
courses.bio: Step-by-step approach from idea to project goals setting and project scope definition.
objectives: Step-by step guidance for transforming an idea into an structured project
Use Logical Framework Approach (LFA) as a project communication and planning tool
Define project objectives
Anticipate project results
Schedule project activities
Consider and monitor project risks and assumptions
Define project metrics or indicators
Connect the project to other strategies or programmes
Established project's cost and budget

Logical Framework Approach (LFA): From the problem tree to logframe

requirements: No prerequisite knowledge is required
courses.description:
You have a project concept, but what should you do next? How do you transform an idea into a well-structured, logical project that produces results? Moreover, there are hundreds of project planning tools accessible, so what is the advantage of using Logframe?
When a number of parties and stakeholders are engaged and the project seems to be a complicated task, defining project scope and objectives may be a difficult process.
We want realistic and effective tools to enable efficient project planning. The logical framework is regarded as one of the most effective planning tools used by the European Commission since it allows us to establish the project scope and objectives without wasting time or effort.
As a consequence of understanding the Logframe technique, you and your team will be able to establish and communicate further in an efficient manner the structure, specific goals, activities, anticipated results, and measures by which the project is monitored in an effective way. It will reduce time significantly when you plan your project next time with the logframe and ensure the delivery of results.
This course will equip you with practical project planning knowledge and skills. You will get step-by step guidance for turning an idea into structured project
target_audience: This course is intended for anybody with an interest in project management practices. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced project manager, understanding Logframe-based project planning will improve your project management competence.

courses.title: MSP® Programme Management v5- Practitioner -Exam Preparation
courses.bio: Extracts from an Accredited Course, Pass with confidence, Helps you get qualified and become immediately productive.
courses.description:
This course prepares you for an internationally recognised qualification in MSP® Programme Management, a best practice for Programme Management.
MSP is the world’s most widely-adopted programme management method, used by people and organizations from wide-ranging industries and sectors.
The Managing Successful Programmes (MSP®) guidance explains the programme management principles, governance themes and transformational flow that should be applied to the management of programmes or transformational change in any environment.
The purpose of the foundation qualification is to determine whether a candidate has sufficient knowledge and understanding of the MSP® guidance to interact effectively with those involved in the management of a programme or act as an informed member of a programme office, business change team or project delivery team working within an environment supporting MSP. The foundation qualification is also a pre-requisite for the practitioner qualification.


The purpose of the practitioner qualification is to determine whether a candidate has sufficient knowledge and understanding of the MSP® guidance to apply the guidance to their own work and, hence, act as an informed member of a programme management team. That is, someone responsible for managing, leading, supporting or advising on work within an MSP environment. Candidates should be capable of applying the MSP® guidance in a relatively uncomplicated programme within an environment that uses MSP.




Beneﬁts of Method:
· Improve your delivery confidence as everyone understands their role in delivering what the business expects.
· Terminology that is common in all projects, programmes & portfolios around the world with a methodology that works ‘effectively with ‘knowledge based practices
· Close your projects well to ensure lessons are captured and project assets are protected
· Structured approach with controls to provide a delivery methodology that works repeatedly and will enable you to successfully deliver projects
· Clearly understand your role, governance and responsibilities including the triggers, inputs and expected outputs
· Start your projects well to ensure successful and consistent delivery to achieve the expected benefits
· Enhance your CV and boost future employment prospects.
This accredited course aims to provide you with a straight forward route to becoming certified at the practitioner level in your own time and at your own pace.
target_audience: This course is aimed at project, programme, business change managers, aspiring programme managers and anyone who manages projects and programmes and preparing for a practitioner qualification.

It is also relevant to other key staff involved in the design, development and delivery of projects and programmes such as Members of a Programme Office (PO), business change team members, project delivery team members, as well as anyone who needs to understand the terminology and concepts underpinning MSP and those wishing to pursue higher level certifications (e.g. programme managers, business change managers (BCMs) and senior responsible owners (SROs).
This is an extract from an accredited course eligible for CPDs/PDUs and prepares you for a practitioner qualification in MSP® Programme Management v5

Course Title: PMP Exam Mindset: One Day to Success
About the Course: Feeling the pressure as the PMP exam looms closer? Don't fret. Welcome to "PMP Exam Mindset: One Day to Success," a dynamic course designed to equip you with the essential tools, strategies, and mindset needed to conquer the PMP exam with confidence.
Led by renowned trainer Phill Akinwale, OPM3, PMP, a distinguished coach with a track record of guiding esteemed organizations such as the FBI, NASA, US Army, and US Army Corps of Engineers, this intensive one-day session is your final stop before the big day.
What You'll Learn:
Comprehensive Coverage: Dive deep into all 35 tasks spanning the people, process, and business domain areas outlined in the PMBOK® Guide. With Phill's expert guidance, you'll grasp the intricacies of each domain, ensuring no stone is left unturned.
Exam Strategy: Learn proven techniques and tactics to tackle the exam efficiently. From time management strategies to question analysis techniques, you'll gain invaluable insights into navigating the exam maze effectively.
Mindset Mastery: Success in the PMP exam isn't just about knowledge; it's about mindset. Phill will arm you with the winning mentality needed to overcome exam jitters, stay focused under pressure, and approach each question with clarity and confidence.
Real-World Insights: Benefit from Phill's extensive experience working with prestigious organizations. Gain practical insights and real-world examples that bring the exam concepts to life, making them easier to understand and apply.
Why Choose Us:
Expert Guidance: With Phill Akinwale at the helm, you're learning from the best in the field. His expertise, combined with a passion for teaching, ensures a transformative learning experience.
Proven Track Record: Phill's coaching has propelled countless professionals to PMP success. Join the ranks of his satisfied students who have aced the exam and advanced their careers.
Last-Minute Prep: Short on time? No problem. This intensive one-day course is tailored for those on the brink of their exam date, providing a focused, high-impact learning experience to maximize your chances of success.
Holistic Approach: Beyond just exam content, we focus on nurturing the right mindset for success. Our holistic approach ensures you're not only prepared academically but mentally ready to conquer the exam.
Your Path to PMP Success Starts Here:
Don't let exam anxiety hold you back. Join us for "PMP Exam Mindset: One Day to Success" and unlock your full potential. Whether you're a seasoned project manager or a newcomer to the field, this course will empower you to face the PMP exam with confidence and emerge victorious. Enroll now and take the first step towards achieving your PMP certification goals!

courses.bio: A complete guide for current or future project managers to the practical aspects of Construction Project Management
objectives: Learn various types of projects in 5 major sectors like Residential, Commercial, Industrial, Institutional and Infrastructure

Visualize various areas and elements involved in different types of projects
Identify the significance and functions of different areas in a project
Discuss about the difference in roles of the same engineer in different project teams
Discuss the scope of work of different stakeholders involved in any project
Identify various documents and data required at all the stages of a project
Learn types of activities involved in a project from its conception to completion
requirements: No prior knowledge is required. This course is aimed at educating you with the basics of Construction Project Management. You will learn everything you need to know from here itself.
courses.description:
This is a complete guide for all architects, engineers and interior designers who wish to obtain knowledge of Construction Project Management.


By Completing CPM Basics 1, 2, 3, You Will Get Knowledge Of All Terminologies Related To Construction Project Management Of Mega Scale Projects And Start Learning CPM Of Mega Projects.
By Completing Series Of Our Mega Project CPM Courses, You Will Achieve High Skills In Handling Mega Construction Project Management In Any Sector Which Will Be At Par Delivered By Any of the World’s Leading University's CPM Courses Or Training Given By Mega Project Heads In Any Sector. In this course, you will learn about the various types of projects, mega projects teams & their roles, and different project data and documents. You will learn all the basics of Construction Project Management.
This course is divided mainly in 3 parts:


HDPM 001 CPM 1: Types of Projects
Here, we will see in detail about:
Type Of Project Sectors Like Residential, Commercial, Industrial etc.
Types Of Projects & Sample Area Visualization in Residential Sector Like Bungalows, Villa, Row Houses, Weekend Villa Townships, Farm Houses, Studio / 1-5 BHK, Apartment Tower, Apartment Townships , Staff Quarters, Labor Colony.
Types Of Projects & Sample Area Visualization in Commercial Sector Like Offices, Corporate Towers, Hotels & Resorts, Restaurants, Food Courts, Hospitals, Clinics Shopping Malls & Multiplex, Mega Events, Amusement Parks.
Types Of Projects & Sample Area Visualization in Institutional Sector Like Schools, Colleges, Hostels, Library, Skill Dev. Centers, Training Centers, Museums, Auditoriums , Exhibition Centers, Sports Complexes.
Types Of Projects & Sample Area Visualization in Industrial Sector Like Power, Solar, Substations , Engineering Industries, PEB Sheds, Logistic Parks, Pharma, Food, R&D Centers, Chemical, Textile, Packaging, Biotech.
Types Of Projects & Sample Area Visualization in Industrial Sector Like Roads, Bridges, Pathways, Road Lighting, Metros, Railways, Airports, Dams, Canals , Water Supply & Drainage, Pumping Stations, Solid Waste Mgmt, CETP.


HDPM 002 CPM 2: Mega Projects Teams & Their Roles
Here, we will see in detail about:
Various Type Of Teams Involved in Mega Projects in various stages From Feasibility To Handover The Project.
Professionals involved in Mega Project Teams Like Client / PMC / Architects & Interiors / Engineering / Contractors / Manufacturers & Suppliers.
1st is Roles Of Client PMC Team having sub teams of Project Coordinators, Finance, Account, Audit Team, Purchase Engineers, Site Manager/Engineers (Civil / Mechanical / Electrical), Liaison Team.
2nd is Roles Of Architect Team having sub teams of Project Coordinators, Architects, Interior Designers, Landscape Designers, 3D Model & Video Makers.
3rd is Roles Of Engineering Design Team having sub teams of Project Coordinators, Civil / Structure, Electrical, Mechanical, Piping & HVAC, Plumbing & FFTG Engineers.
4th is Roles Of Contractor Teams like Civil/Piping/HVAC/ Electrical/Plumbing/FFTG/Interior Contractors,
Role of their sub teams of Site Engineers, Civil ,Mechanical, Electrical, Purchase / Contract Engineers, Billing  Engineers, Site Supervisors, Technicians, Store Keepers.
5th is Roles Of Supplier / Manufacturer Team having sub teams of Project Coordinators, Process Engineers, Design Engineers, Purchase & Contract Engineers, Supervisors, Technicians, Erection & Commissioning Engineers.




HDPM 003 CPM 3: Mega Project Design Steps
Here, we will see in detail about:
1. PROJECT DESIGN STEPS
Project Design Steps And Process Chronology From Feasibility To Complete Handover Of The Project
2. TYPES OF PROJECT DATA / DOCUMENTS
Each Type Of Data Or Documents Generated In Entire Span Of The Project For Architecture / Civil / Mechanical Piping, HVAC, Electrical And Plumbing (MEP) Works During Design Or Execution Phases Of The Project.
3. TYPES OF PROJECT DRAWINGS
Various Types Of Drawings Generated In The Entire Span Of The Project Like Architecture / Structure / Piping / HVAC / Electrical / Plumbing /Fire Fighting Etc.
4. ROOM DATA SHEET (RDS) TO START DESIGN
Room Wise User/ Client Requirements Tabulation In Sheet Called Room Data Sheet
RDS For Architectural / Civil Finishes Data Eg Floor, Paint, Windows, Doors, Ceiling Etc
RDS For Utility Requirements For Room/ Machines Eg Air, Raw-RO-DRO-Hot-DM-Soft-Chilled-WFI Water, Steam, Gas, Effluent Etc
RDS For Electrical Requirements For Lux, Lighting, Power, Low Voltage, Cctv, Ups , Stabilized Power Etc
RDS For HVAC Requirements for air conditions, pressure, class, Humidity etc


CONCLUSION
You will understand each word regarding Designing Start-up & Deliverables in Any Sector Mega Projects.
By Completing CPM Basics 1, 2, 3, You will get knowledge of all Terminology related to Construction Project Management Of Mega Scale Projects and Start Learning CPM Of Mega Projects.


You will get a lifetime access to all these lectures, PPTs and the book whenever you want to revisit!
You can also check out our other courses where we have covered various Construction Project Management topics in detail.
So what are you waiting for? Join the course now and create the projects you always dreamed of!!
target_audience: Aspiring and current engineering professionals who intend to gain knowledge about the practical applications of Construction Project Management.

courses.title: Project Management Professional (PMP/CAPM) Exam Preparation
courses.bio: Project Managers earn six figure salaries and are in hot demand. Join this elite group and elevate your career.
objectives: The PMBOK® Guide only summarizes or lists Project Management framework and context topics in Chapters 1 and 2. The entire book is basically a reference book for the PMI project management standard. It is not oriented toward learning the material. For this reason, the class covers each framework, context, standard, and knowledge area topic in detail with information from the source reference materials used to create the exam. General knowledge that the project manager is expected to know through experience and prior training is covered, so that the course is comprehensive in preparing you to take the test.
Note: PMI is the owner of the registered trademark for Project Management Professional (PMP/CAPM) (PMP,CAPM)®

Introduction: Introduction - How to Use the Course
How to download Exercise Files and Handouts

requirements: No prerequisite course. You will need access to a copy of the PMBOK® Guide Fifth Edition, which is available as a download from the PMI website for PMI members, or may be purchased in hardcopy from the PMI Bookstore on the website, or in most major bookstores, including on-line bookstores.
Note: PMI is the owner of the registered trademark for Project Management Professional (PMP/CAPM) (PMP,CAPM)®
courses.description:
Major corporations are adopting A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) 5th Edition, from the Project Management Institute, and the related Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification, as the primary sources of competency in the field of Project Management.
Market research indicates that employers want to hire project management practitioners who have real experience leading and directing projects. To better meet this need, PMI is incorporating in the certification application process the requirement to document experience leading and directing the various tasks required in effective project management. In addition, PMI is placing increased emphasis on situational questions in the testing process for the PMP Certification to better evaluate applicant skill in actually using their PMBOK® Guide knowledge. This has made the PMP Certification test harder than it was in the past, and increases the value of preparation course work prior to taking the test. This course, along with the review of materials and repeated practice testing, will more than adequately prepare student to take the PMP Certification Exam. For those individuals who cannot qualify for the PMP Certification Exam, this course will amply prepare them to sit for the CAPM Certification Exam.
***** THE MOST RELEVANT CONTENT TO GET YOU UP TO SPEED *****
***** COURSE UPDATED: February 2016 *****

courses.title: Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) Practice Exam 2025
courses.bio: PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP | PMI ACP) Question Test | Simulate Mock Exam - Updated 2025 [Unofficial]
courses.description:
The PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) certification is designed for professionals who are involved in agile project management. This certification recognizes an individual’s expertise and knowledge in agile practices and principles, which are highly valued in today’s fast-paced and adaptive project environments.
Who Should Get the PMI-ACP Certification?
Project Managers: Those who are managing agile projects or transitioning from traditional project management to agile environments.
Agile Team Members: Individuals working within agile teams in roles such as Scrum Master, Product Owner, or Agile Coach.
IT Professionals: Software developers, testers, and IT managers looking to expand their knowledge and skills in agile methodologies.
Business Analysts: Professionals involved in requirement gathering and analysis in agile projects.
Any Professionals: Those who wish to demonstrate their knowledge and skills in agile practices across various industries.
Learning Objectives
Understand Agile Principles and Mindset: Gain a deep understanding of agile principles and how they apply to real-world situations.
Agile Frameworks and Tools: Learn about different agile methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban, Lean, XP, and their tools and techniques.
Stakeholder Engagement: Master ways to engage and communicate effectively with stakeholders.
Continuous Improvement: Learn how to foster a culture of continuous improvement in projects.
Problem Detection and Resolution: Develop skills to swiftly identify and resolve issues in agile projects.
Exam Format
Number of Questions: 120 multiple-choice questions
Exam Duration: 3 hours
Exam Type: Computer-based, can be taken at a testing center or online
Languages Available: The exam is primarily conducted in English, but other language aids may be available.
Passing Score
PMI does not publicly disclose the exact passing score for the PMI-ACP exam. The results are based on the overall performance across the exam. However, it’s generally suggested to aim for scoring around 70% or higher to be on the safe side.
Four Reasons to Choose My Practice Questions
Updated Content for 2025: Our practice questions are continuously updated to reflect the latest PMI-ACP exam content and agile practices, ensuring you have the most current and relevant study material.
Real-World Scenario Questions: The practice questions are designed to mimic real exam scenarios, helping you apply agile concepts to practical situations which is crucial for understanding and passing the exam.
Detailed Explanations and References: Each question comes with detailed explanations and references to agile resources, enabling you to thoroughly understand the reasoning behind correct answers and learn from any mistakes.
Performance Analytics: Our practice platform offers analytics to track your progress, strengths, and areas of improvement, allowing you to focus your study efforts more effectively and boost your confidence before the exam.
By pursuing the PMI-ACP certification and utilizing these practice questions, students will be well-prepared for the exam and possess a robust understanding of agile methodologies that can be applied in their careers.
target_audience: Project Managers: Those who are managing agile projects or transitioning from traditional project management to agile environments.

Business Analysts: Professionals involved in requirement gathering and analysis in agile projects.

courses.title: Project Management Fundamentals in Healthcare
courses.bio: Closing the gap between completing healthcare projects and SUCCESSFULLY completing healthcare projects
objectives: Basic project management principles and how to apply them to healthcare projects

How to create a project implementation toolkit

Introduction to Healthcare Project Manag: Course Objectives/Intro to the Life Cycle

requirements: Passion for bringing healthcare projects to successful completion!
courses.description:
Have you ever wondered why the programs at your organization aren't fully adopted? Why it feels like each department works in a silo instead of resembling actual teammates? Why the ball gets dropped so often? Why there's so much miscommunication? Why people keep doing things the way they've always been doing them - even if those processes aren't working?
If you answered yes to any of those questions - then this course if for you!
This course is a combination of the best of my Healthcare Project Management (101) and Healthcare Project Management v2.0 (102) courses. The first half of this course provides an introduction to project management terminology and the project life cycle. While the second half of this course will repeat and build off of those concepts, diving deeper into each. The second part of this course also includes assignments and resources to encourage you to further apply your newly gained knowledge. Because stories are known to improve learning, I've created healthcare project scenarios that we'll follow throughout the entire course to help the information stick! You'll also have an opportunity to create your own clinic profile and apply the information learned to a project unique to your organization.
I was a physical therapist that wore the hat of project manager in my organization for years without knowing what a project manager was. Now that I've formally studied the field, received my certification, and have been a practicing project manager in the healthcare space for years, it's my goal to pass on the 'what-I-wish-I-had-knowns' to my fellow clinicians-turned-project managers/leads. Together we can make a positive difference in the awesome world of healthcare!
Let the journey begin!
CONTINUING EDUCATION NOTES:
PMP(R) Certificate Holders: This course content is appropriate to be self-logged for 2 PDUs for Ways of Working under the Education category. Nothing will be automatically added to your Dashboard after taking this course. You will have to manually log into your PMI(R) account and self-enter the PDUs in your Dashboard. Please message me with any questions on how to log your PDUs.
Physical Therapists/PTAs: For the year 2025 - This course is approved for 1 continuing education credit by the West Virginia Board of Physical Therapy (WVBOPT) for physical therapists and physical therapy assistants in the United States. Please message me for details on obtaining the appropriate course certificate if this applies to you. (Note: Credit can only be awarded to each participant one time, as it is the same course being presented in multiple packages. Message me with any questions. Participants licensed in other states are responsible for checking if their state of licensure will accept the WVBOPT approval) Thank you!

courses.description:

This course is carefully designed to prepare you for the PMI-ACP exam with a blend of clear explanations, practical examples, and proven study strategies, all aimed at helping you achieve certification success on your first attempt.
Agile is transforming the way projects are delivered across industries, enabling teams to adapt quickly, respond to change, and deliver value faster. courses.description:
The Human Resource Development: Regulations and Organizational Development course is the 10th of 20 courses developed as part of the Human Resources Certification Program.
In this course, the focus will be on human resource development, or HRD, and organizational development, or OD, and the activities and initiatives involved.
It provides an overview of HRD and its key components, along with key federal legislation that affects both the development and delivery of HRD programs. This course also examines OD theories and applications and provides direction to HR professionals on how to ensure OD initiatives support organizational objectives.
Employee development theories are also addressed, as well as how to approach employee training program activities. In topic one, the relationship of human resource development to the organization, the areas of adult learning processes, human relations concepts and applications, and ethical and professional standards will be addressed.
Ideas and facts cannot be copyrighted. In topic two, Federal Laws and Regulations Related to HRD Activities, you'll increase your knowledge of applicable federal laws and regulations related to HRD activities.
A strong culture is usually associated with high-performing organizations. In topic three, Organizational Development Theories and Applications, you'll become more familiar with the theories and applications used in organizational development programs.
Quality efforts are an integral part of ensuring employees are productive and engaged. In topic four, Organizational Development Task and Process Analysis, you'll gain a better understanding of quality management, the systems theory, and some of the tools they employ.
The adult learner values the ability to apply learning immediately to solve current problems. In topic five,Employee Development Theories and Applications, you'll look at some important theories on how adult learners learn and what motivates them.
That’s it! Now, go ahead and push that “Take this course” button and see you on the inside!
target_audience: Young professionals who are just beginning their HR career journey (aPHR Certification)
Experienced professionals looking to establish themselves in the HR field (PHR Certification)
Seasoned professionals to solidify their credibility as an HR leader (SPHR Certification)

The Course Include
2 Exams each Exam contains 40 question.

courses.description:

These 8 videos will explain the Project Risk Management Knowledge Area of the PMBOK® 6th Edition.

courses.title: Project Management - How to Cost Management Plan

courses.description:
Join Jamal, an esteemed project management consultant with over 25 years of experience, in this comprehensive course on cost management planning. Benefit from his extensive expertise in costing exercises for major projects and gain the skills needed to develop effective cost management plans.
Begin with a concise overview of the project manager's responsibilities and the pivotal role of the cost management plan within the broader project plan. Dive into the subsections of the Project Cost Management Plan, including the Cost Management Approach, Measuring Project Costs, Reporting Format, Cost Variance Response Process, Cost Change Control Process, and Project Budget.
Explore two distinct Cost Management Approaches: cost variances and Earned Value Management (EVM). Discover how to measure project costs using either the variance formula (Budgeted Expense minus Actual Cost) or EVM metrics such as Schedule Variance (SV), Cost Variance (CV), Schedule Performance Index (SPI), Cost Performance Index (CPI), and Estimate at Completion (EAC).
Delve into the intricacies of Cost Reporting Format and learn about effective Cost Variance Response Processes. Gain valuable insights into the Cost Change Control Process, encompassing Change Requests and the assessment of their impact on the project.
Lastly, focus on Project Budgets and explore various budgeting approaches, including team-based, department-based, vendor vs. internal costs, fixed vs. variable costs, expense types, and Capital Expenditure (Capex) vs. Operational Expenditure (Opex).
By enrolling in this course, you'll equip yourself with practical knowledge and techniques to develop robust cost management plans, measure project costs accurately, and implement effective cost control strategies. Don't miss this opportunity to enhance your project management skills. Enroll now and take your cost management expertise to new heights.

courses.description:
I’m Scott Dunn. I’m a certified Scrum trainer and Agile coach. I do public training, such as the certified scrum master and the certified product owner class, as well as private trainings in companies across the nation.
In this class, I will give you and your team enough information to baseline everyone, and let you get going with Scrum and Agile: what it means to be Agile, what Scrum is and how it is Agile, the roles and the meetings in Scrum, and the underpinnings and requirements of Scrum.
In the class videos, I try to incorporate my usual engaging style with lots of examples and stories. We’ve created an accompanying .pdf handout to give you some walk away notes and resources to dive in deeper on the points that interest you in particular. This video could be used with teams or management to help get everyone on the same page about what it means to be Agile and implement Scrum.
Students will fill in blanks and diagrams on the handout as they follow along with the videos. Students will complete several application exercises throughout the course. The video run time is a little over an hour... about 70 minutes. If students do all the exercises, they should be able to finish in less than 2 hours.
We're going to cover all this and more in a one hour baseline overview that I hope is something that gives you a good sense of what Agile is, what it means to be Agile, and how we do Scrum. This course is not just for individuals, but hopefully for teams as well, to iron out some of the problems that they might face going forward.
I will be circling back to the class discussion area around once a week to respond to discussions and provide additional input. If any student wants to get immediate contact with me, I am available via Google + https://plus.google.com/+Rocketninesolutions/videos, as well as, email scott@RocketNineSolutions.com ,Blog http://scottdunn.blogspot.com/ , and Twitter: @sdunnrocket9

courses.title: General contractor Exam Questions Practice Test
courses.bio: A complete practice test to pass your General contractor Exam
courses.description:
A general contractor is a professional who manages the construction of buildings, roads, bridges, or other infrastructure projects. They oversee all aspects of a construction project, from the planning and design stages to the final inspection and handover. They are responsible for hiring and supervising subcontractors, negotiating contracts, and ensuring that the project is completed on time and within budget. General contractors typically have a background in construction, engineering, or architecture, and they may be licensed by their state or province to perform construction work.
General contractor is a manager, and possibly a tradesman, employed by the client on the advice of the architect, engineer or the architectural technologist or the client him/herself if acting as the manager. A general contractor is responsible for the overall coordination of a project. A general contractor must first assess the project-specific documents (referred to as bid, proposal or tender documents). In the case of renovations, a site visit is required to get a better understanding of the project. Depending on the project delivery method, the contractor will submit a fixed price proposal or bid, cost plus price or an estimate. The general contractor considers the cost of home office overhead, general conditions, materials and equipment as well as the cost of labor to provide the owner with a price for the project.


Contract documents include drawings, project manual (including general, supplementary and/or special conditions and specifications), addendum or modifications issued prior to proposal/ bidding and prepared by a design professional such as an architect. The general contractor may be the construction manager or construction manager at high risk.


There are no set educational qualifications to become a general contractor, though many employers prefer a bachelor's degree. Some general contractors obtain bachelor's degrees in construction science, building science, surveying, construction safety, or other disciplines.
Most of the construction professionals are aware about the poor performance of construction, yet we keep seeing projects fail and lose money. Despite all the innovations and all the project management methodologies that are being implemented, the industry is still far to be efficient. The true problem is that we are not mastering the basics due to the lack of trainings and mentorship.
The goal of this course, is to teach you the basics. The basics of commercial and contractual knowledge skills and knowledge that you were not exposed to, the basics that we thought they are not for engineers, the basics that should be mastered by anyone working in the construction sector.
My goal is to share all the experience, knowledge and skills that I’ve I have gained from real work experiences in different tenders, mega projects; and international clients in different countries and present them to you as lessons to learn from.
The course is structured into 5 chapters, These chapters will describe the story of a Contract from its formation by the client till its execution by Contractors. This course will be your guide in any construction project and the way to improve your career path.
In the first two chapters, we will start talking about the basics in the construction. The skills and attitude of a project manager, and what you are missing to enhance your career. We will talk about how to read and understand international forms of agreement, the structure of any bidding documents and many more.
In chapter three, we will see how the contract is formed and developed by the Client. We will come across the important terms and conditions used in most of the agreements. I will introduce the risk management process and how risks are playing a major role in the preparation of any contract. We will talk about the choice of the right contract form, bonds and guarantees that the client can use to guarantee the success of his investment.
In chapter four, we will come across the typical disputes that occur in the industry, the common contractual pitfalls. We will see the root causes of these problems and how we can avoid them.
In the last chapter, we will see how the contractor can win and complete a successful project, starting from the estimation and bidding stage, passing through the award and negotiation of the contract, till its execution and administration.
We will talk about many topics, with real case studies.
target_audience: Who wants to seat for General contractor Exam

courses.description:
How to write a project proposal
A project proposal aims to get approval for a project from key stakeholders.
Project proposals are documents that define your project. They tell your customers how your project ideas should be executed. In this class, I will explain in detail how you can write an effective project proposal.
You need to install Microsoft Office Word because we will write many practical examples for project proposals.


Course Outline
What is a project proposal?
Why do you need to write a project proposal?
Advantages of a clear project proposal
How to be prepared before writing a good project proposal?
Steps to writing your project proposal
Tips for writing an effective project proposal
Best Practices For Writing Project Proposals
Project Proposal Template and Examples
Final Thoughts and Class Project
The project asks the student to apply what he/she has learnt by writing a project proposal document.
By following the steps and the tips that the student will learn in this class, the student will be able to write a good and valuable project proposal.


How to write a Business Use case
The business use case is a description of how a person who uses the process or system will accomplish a goal. Business use cases are popular techniques for documenting and understanding system requirements, and I will teach you how to write them in a good and valuable way by following these steps:
Identify the Actors
Identify the Goal
Define the Pre-Conditions and Post-Conditions
Describe the Main Flow
Describe the Alternate Flows and Exceptions
The main purpose of writing a use case is to explore and highlight the value of your business, industry, or system.
Use cases can be valuable tools for understanding a specific system's ability to meet the needs of end-users.
Use cases can also be effective for product marketing purposes.
The project asks the student to apply what he/she has learnt by writing a business use case document.


I will be available to answer students' questions so send me your questions in a message.
Good Luck to all students
Happy Learning!
AM Learning
Make Learning Fun

The "Mastering Oracle Primavera P6 for Project Management Success" course is designed to provide professionals with a comprehensive understanding of Oracle's Primavera P6, a leading project management tool. This course covers the foundations of project management with P6, project development, budgeting, reporting, and advanced Primavera features. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced project manager, this course will equip you with the skills needed to manage projects effectively using Primavera P6.


Section 1: Overview
The course begins with an introductory section that sets the foundation for learning Oracle Primavera P6. In Lecture 1: Overview of Primavera, students get a high-level understanding of the importance and use of Primavera in managing large-scale projects. This preview provides a glimpse into the platform's capabilities and how it can enhance project management efficiency across various industries.


Section 2: Primavera: 01 - The Foundation
This section delves into the basics of Primavera P6 and the fundamentals of project management using the platform. Lecture 2: Introduction to Project Management Using P6 introduces participants to the software and its core functions. In the following lectures, students learn to Login to Primavera and get an in-depth Definition of Primavera, followed by a Description of Primavera to understand its primary functions. Why P6 and its Strengths and Strengths First View explore the advantages of using P6 over other project management tools. The section rounds off with practical aspects, such as Arranging Reports, understanding A Typical P6 Screen, and learning about the various Screen Components and Tools and Symbols that enhance user experience. The final lectures, Set Language and Selection Methods, prepare students for a smoother and more personalized workflow within Primavera.


Section 3: Primavera: 02 - Project Codes and Developing Activity
In this section, the focus shifts to project setup, codes, and activity development. Lectures cover essential features like User Preferences and Project Management Screens, providing the groundwork for starting and managing projects. From Starting a New Project to Creating EPS and Edit, students will understand how to structure projects using WBS (Work Breakdown Structure) and manage resources with Resource Codes and Activity Codes. This section also covers more advanced aspects like Assigning Resources, Time Sheets, and Developing Relationships. By the end of this section, participants will have a strong grasp of creating, organizing, and tracking project activities in Primavera P6.


Section 4: Primavera: 03 - Budgeting and Customizing
This section dives deep into the financial aspects of project management with Primavera. Lectures such as Managing Budgeting and Baseline vs Current Project teach participants how to track and compare project financials. The section covers essential skills like Scheduling, balancing resources, and customizing layouts, charts, and views to tailor the software for specific project needs. Participants also learn how to track project progress effectively using various Primavera customization options.


Section 5: Primavera: 04 - Reporting and Graphics
In this section, participants will explore the extensive reporting capabilities of Primavera P6. From learning about Data Grouping and presentation methods to mastering the Report Wizard, this section teaches how to generate detailed, insightful reports for stakeholders. Lectures on S Curves, Web and HTML Options, and Security and Integrity emphasize the importance of graphical representation and secure data management in project reporting. Participants will be able to customize and deliver comprehensive reports and graphics that align with project goals.


Section 6: PPI: 01 - The Fundamentals
This section introduces the Project Productivity Improvement (PPI) framework, which helps participants streamline project workflows and boost efficiency. Lectures focus on different aspects of project workflow, from Service Request Functions to Implementation Planning and Production Support. This section is essential for those looking to enhance productivity and ensure a smooth flow in project operations.


Section 7: PPI: 02 - Primavera Products and Features
Participants will learn about various Primavera products and their functionalities in this section. Starting with an Introduction to Primavera and moving on to Enterprise Value and Key Features, this section covers everything from P6 Professional features to integration with EPPM (Enterprise Project Portfolio Management). The lectures provide a thorough understanding of how Primavera’s different products work together to support comprehensive project management.


Section 8: PPI: 03 - Primavera Program Management
This section emphasizes program management using Primavera. Participants will gain insights into managing multiple projects, cross-project visibility, and critical path analysis. Lectures cover managing both simple and complex projects and improving lifecycle visibility, which is crucial for managing large programs efficiently.


Section 9: PPI: 04 - Primavera Practicals
In the final practical section, participants get hands-on experience with Primavera through various real-world scenarios. They will learn how to manage the project lifecycle, handle data in P6, and execute projects using timesheets and Gantt charts. The section covers advanced topics like Critical Path Method Scheduling and Assigning Constraints, providing a well-rounded practical understanding of project management in P6.


Conclusion:
This comprehensive course on Oracle Primavera P6 equips project managers with the necessary skills to manage projects efficiently using the powerful P6 tool. From the fundamentals to advanced project management techniques, participants will be ready to tackle projects of any scale by the end of this course.
target_audience: Project Managers Those responsible for planning, executing, and managing projects across industries, and who want to streamline their scheduling and resource management using Primavera P6.
Planners and Schedulers Professionals in charge of creating and managing project schedules will benefit from learning the advanced scheduling tools and techniques in Primavera P6.

Construction Professionals Engineers, architects, and construction managers who manage complex projects with multiple tasks, dependencies, and timelines will find this course particularly useful for improving project delivery.
Engineers Engineers involved in planning and executing projects in industries like manufacturing, civil engineering, and oil & gas will learn to handle large-scale project data using Primavera P6.
Consultants Project management consultants looking to improve their service offerings by mastering Primavera P6 for better planning, risk analysis, and project control.

courses.description:
Asta Powerproject is easy-to-use and extremely powerful project management software and preferred by thousands of construction professionals throughout the world.
During this advanced course, we will focus on direct costs, learn cost modelling types and how to create financial plan of the project analyzing cost through net cash flow graphs, histograms and reports.
We will learn how to manage permanent and consumable resources, creating resource pool, solving over allocation, working with resource work break down structure and understanding the cost associated with resources.
We will continue with baseline projects with reverting and merging options. We will discover backward planning, adding lead and lag duration to tasks and learn how constraints effect scheduling. We will update the project and monitor progress.
We will manage risk using Monte Carlo and Latin Hypercube sampling methods, analyze what if scenarios to pick the best option for a success project delivery.

courses.title: PRINCE2® 7 FOUNDATION REAL EXAM Q&As: STRAIGHTWAY TO SUCCSES
courses.bio: PRINCE2® 7 Foundation Exam Prep - 2025 Simulator - ALL VERIFIED REAL Q&AS - YOUR SHORTEST PATH TO PRINCE2® CERTIFICATION
courses.description:
I- ABOUT THIS COURSE: YOUR SHORTEST PATH TO PRINCE2® 7 FOUNDATION SUCCESS
This course is meticulously designed to significantly boost your chances of passing the PRINCE2® 7 Foundation exam. It provides comprehensive practice with realistic questions and targeted strategies, empowering you to face your PeopleCert examination day confidently.
If you aim to achieve your PRINCE2® 7 Foundation certification efficiently, this course offers exclusive access to proven Q&As that will make a tangible difference in your exam results!
*IMPORTANT NOTE*
This course complements your existing study of the official PRINCE2® 7th Edition manual or an accredited training course. It will not teach you the PRINCE2 method from scratch, but will significantly enhance your exam readiness and confidence.
Ensure you fully understand the PRINCE2 7th Edition concepts before diving into these practice questions for maximum benefit.
I.1- What You Will Gain & Course Highlights:
15-20% Higher Passing Probability: Mastering these 330+ carefully selected questions can significantly improve your chances of passing the PRINCE2® 7 Foundation exam on your first attempt.
330+ Questions Sourced From Actual Exams: Each question is crafted to reflect the style, difficulty, and content areas of the actual PRINCE2® Foundation 7th Edition exam.
Real Exam Simulation: Get accustomed to the exam format and types of questions, reducing anxiety and improving time management for the real test.
Expert-Aligned Content: Questions and explanations are aligned with the PRINCE2® 7 Foundation syllabus by PeopleCert/Axelos, ensuring accuracy and relevance.
Deepen Your PRINCE2 Understanding: Solidify your grasp of PRINCE2 principles, practices, processes, and the new 7th Edition emphases.
Benchmark Your Readiness: Use this course to gauge your preparedness and accurately identify areas needing further focus.
Step-by-Step Rationales: Learn the 'why' behind each answer with clear explanations, enhancing your critical thinking and understanding of the method.
I.2- Who Should Enroll:
Individuals preparing for the PRINCE2® 7 Foundation certification exam.
Aspiring and current project managers need a globally recognized project management certification.
Project team members, support staff, and managers wishing to understand the PRINCE2 methodology.
Professionals seeking to update their knowledge to the latest PRINCE2 7th Edition.
I.3- How Do You Self-Assess Using This Course?
Your scores on the practice tests are key indicators (official pass mark is 60%):
Less than 60% Correct: Intensive review of the PRINCE2 7th Edition manual and concepts is needed.
60% to Less than 70% Correct: You’re on the right track; focus on weak areas and understanding explanations.
Over 70% Correct Consistently: You are likely well-prepared for the PRINCE2® Foundation exam.
II- ABOUT THE PRINCE2®7  FOUNDATION CERTIFICATE & EXAM
II.1- The PRINCE2® Foundation Certificate The PRINCE2® Foundation certification is a globally recognized credential that confirms you have sufficient knowledge and understanding of the PRINCE2 project management method to be able to work effectively with, or as a member of, a project management team working within an environment supporting PRINCE2. The 7th Edition reflects the latest best practices in project management.
II.2- The PRINCE2® 7 Foundation 2025 Exam, administered by PeopleCert on behalf of Axelos, assesses your ability to understand the PRINCE2 method.
Focus: Core principles, practices, processes, and the overall structure of the PRINCE2 7th Edition method.
Exam Details:
Questions: 60 multiple-choice questions
Time Limit: 60 minutes
Passing Score: 60% (36 out of 60 correct)
Format: Closed book
II.3- Exam Content Overview (7th Edition Focus) The PRINCE2® 7 Foundation exam will test your knowledge on:
PRINCE2 Principles: (e.g., Ensure continued business justification, Learn from experience, Define roles, responsibilities & relationships, Manage by stages, Manage by exception, Focus on products, Tailor to suit the project).
PRINCE2 Practices (Themes): Integrated elements applied throughout the project (e.g., Business Case, Organizing, Quality, Plans, Risk, Issues, Progress). The 7th Edition refines these and enhances their application.
PRINCE2 Processes: The structured set of activities designed to accomplish a specific objective within a project (e.g., Starting up a project, Directing a project, Initiating a project, Controlling a stage, Managing product delivery, Managing a stage boundary, Closing a project).
Key 7th Edition Emphases:
People: Central to successful projects, integrating this aspect throughout the method.
Project Performance: Encompassing sustainability and effective data management.
Digital and Data: Utilizing digital tools and data for improved project management.
III- WHERE TO GET MORE SUPPORT?
Upon enrollment, you can ask questions through the course Q&A or via direct messaging. Our dedicated support team, including experienced PRINCE2® certified professionals, is available to provide prompt and expert guidance.
Don't wait! Enroll now for the ultimate preparation advantage for your PRINCE2® 7 Foundation exam!
target_audience: Those who are preparing for the PRINCE2® 7 FOUNDATION exam.
Anyone who wants to delve deeper into project works and the PRINCE2® 7 FOUNDATION exam.
Those who want to supplement their knowledge for the latest PRINCE2® 7 FOUNDATION exam for other purposes.

courses.description:
Being able to improve your organisational processes and operational performance is a skill highly in demand in today's workforce. In this course, we cover off the key information you will need in order to build and deploy an effective continuous improvement plan. Such plans have the powerful ability to structure your approach, identify your goals and give you a space in which you can sell your vision to interested parties.
Within this course we:
- Look at the fundamentals of the topic - continuous improvement and the plan.
- Investigate the activities you should be undertaking before starting your plan.
- Breakdown the plan into its constituent parts, addressing each section using a scenario example.
- Use a scenario to frame how you would build your plan, giving you a practical example of how to practically build each part of the plan.
- We will also run through a case study example of a real life plan.
The plan can be used for several purposes. It can act as a business case to get approval to launch the project, a storyboard to get buy in and support from the wider business / team and as the firing gun for a project charter / plan. The document will also hold all of the key items required for the successful completion of the project - current state, future state, gap analysis, pilot and testing etc. It really is a great plan that greatly improves your chance of success!
target_audience: Anyone currently working for a company who wants to improve the business
Anyone who owns a business / manages a department and wants to improve operational performance
Anyone who wants to upskill in this field as improving your business from within is a skill HIGHLY in demand

courses.title: GO AHEAD to become Global Certified PMI-RMP

courses.description:
The PMI-RMP simulation exams are practice tests that simulate the actual PMI-RMP certification exam. These exams are designed to help you assess your readiness for the PMI-RMP exam by providing you with an opportunity to test your knowledge and skills in a simulated exam environment. The PMI-RMP simulation exams include questions that cover the same topics and concepts as the actual exam, allowing you to get a feel for the type of questions you can expect on the real exam.


The PMI-RMP simulation exams course typically includes multiple practice exams, each consisting of 25,50,100,170 & 170 multiple-choice questions, just like the actual exam. The exams are timed, and you will have four hours to complete each exam. The questions on the exams are designed to test your knowledge of risk management principles, tools, and techniques, as well as your ability to apply them to real-world situations.


As you take the simulation exams, you will receive feedback on your performance and be able to identify areas where you need to improve your knowledge or exam-taking skills. The course may also provide study materials, such as practice questions, study guides, and other resources to help you prepare for the exam.


Taking the PMI-RMP simulation exams is an excellent way to prepare for the actual PMI-RMP certification exam, as it helps you get familiar with the exam format, types of questions, and time management skills required to pass the exam. By taking multiple practice exams and reviewing your results, you can increase your confidence and improve your chances of passing the PMI-RMP certification exam on your first attempt.
target_audience: all Project Management Practitioners & all concerned Risk Management
Whom aspire Risk Management Professional Global Certification PMI-RMP

courses.title: Forecast Hybrid Agile Projects and Manage with Confidence
courses.bio: Step-by-step guide on how to forecast the Delivery Date of Agile projects that have pre-defined requirements.
objectives: How the provided spreadsheet enables you to forecast a project with a predefined set of requirements, without waiting for your team to estimate every task
How to easily import data from JIRA in the provided spreadsheet
How to use the provided spreadsheet to accurately forecast the delivery date of your project
How to plan even better by forecasting per sub-team

Setup Our Tools: Review Quiz on Setup Our Tools
Import Data: Import Data Using the JIRA Cloud Plugin

requirements: An initial effort estimation for the whole project, broken down to Features or Components; usually there should be an Initial Offer with such a break-down that you can use for this purpose
Desktop Excel, Online Excel or Google Sheets
Use Story Points, Story Points Estimate or Original Time Estimate to estimate tasks
JIRA or any tool that can give you an export of your tasks with their estimates and assignees, and the velocity of the team
Be able to identify if a Feature/Component has been fully analyzed and estimated
courses.description:
Agile is a great framework, but it is designed for projects without a specific scope. You are supposed to start working on the project with an overall idea of where you want to go and the specifics are discovered along the way.
The majority of projects though tend to be Hybrid Agile, in the sense that they have a waterfall approach with a predefined set of requirements, but still use Agile to manage the day-to-day processes.
Agile tools for forecasting projects, though, are not meant for Hybrid projects. They focus on forecasting epics or versions and assume that you have all the stories estimated in your backlog. In a Hybrid six-month project this is impossible since you cannot have your team estimate the whole project at once.
In this course, you will receive a spreadsheet that enables you to forecast a Hybrid Agile project as a whole (not just an epic) by using your Initial Offer (the initial break-down of the project in estimated features) as a reference. In this way, you don't have to estimate the whole project with your team, instead you use the team's estimates sprint after sprint to increase the accuracy of your forecast as the project progresses.
Once you complete the course, you will have a real tool in your hands that will enable you to get a fresh status of your project with a few clicks and with minor manual work, including a forecast of the completion time of the whole project.
target_audience: Anyone that uses Agile for projects with a predefined scope and delivery date, and needs to forecast the time of completion of the whole project, not only of any epic or a release.
