Are you ready to manage projects that create value not just for your organization—but for people and the planet too? Sustainable Project Management is your step-by-step guide to integrating environmental, social, and economic sustainability into every phase of your projects. Whether you are a project manager, team leader, sustainability consultant, CSR officer, or simply passionate about green business practices, this course will equip you with the tools, frameworks, and mindset needed to deliver projects that truly make a difference.
In this practical and comprehensive course, you will learn how to embed sustainability into the project lifecycle—from initiating and planning through execution, monitoring, and closure. We’ll explore globally recognized frameworks like ISO 14001, the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), and the GPM P5 Standard, showing you exactly how to apply them in real-world settings.
You will discover how to create sustainability-focused project charters, define and track green KPIs, manage suppliers using sustainable procurement strategies, and identify risks linked to environmental and social factors. The course will also guide you in using tools like risk registers, KPI trackers, sustainability audits, and earned value analysis that includes sustainability metrics.
Case studies—including a detailed electric vehicle (EV) transition project—illustrate how these principles come to life in the field. You’ll gain practical experience through hands-on exercises and assignments designed to help you apply what you learn immediately.
By the end of this course, you’ll be able to:
Design and execute projects that balance profit, people, and planet goals
Align project activities with global sustainability standards and ESG requirements
Monitor and report sustainability performance credibly and effectively
Lead teams that prioritize green innovation and responsible decision-making
No prior experience in sustainability or project management is required—this course provides step-by-step instruction suitable for beginners and experienced professionals alike. Get started today and build the skills to lead sustainable projects that create lasting impact!

the passing score for t his exam is 74%
with the following notes:
1- Your Score: >80% - EXCELLENT: Revisit the explanations of the Q's you have got wrong, enhance your learnings & proceed to next section.
2- Your Score: 60-80% - AVERAGE: You need to focus on analyzing the Q's and explanations you got wrong & restudy questions and answers to develop your knowledge before moving to the next section.

requirements: Knowledge of Project Management
courses.description:
Embark on a transformative journey with Jamal, a highly experienced project and portfolio management consultant, as he shares his profound insights into creating a Rolling Financial Forecast. Leveraging his 25 years of industry expertise, Jamal will guide you through the intricate process of effectively managing project financial forecasts.
In this course, we will commence by providing a concise overview of rolling financial forecasts and their significance within the project management realm. Explore the fundamental principles that govern this practice, including tolerance levels for monthly and total variances, encompassing both positive and negative deviations.
Join us as we debunk the prevalent myth of "+/-10% estimation accuracy" and shed light on how senior sponsors navigate around it, allowing you to navigate these complexities with confidence.
The centerpiece of this course is a meticulous, step-by-step analysis of a real project's rolling financial forecast. Gain invaluable insights into creating the initial forecast and various estimation techniques, such as team assessments, historical data, and 90% confidence levels. As we progress through the project timeline, we will explore safeguarding your Total Contingency, addressing monthly variances (both positive and negative), mitigating project delays, and systematically replenishing the contingency fund to the PMO.
By the end of this course, you will possess the tools and knowledge necessary to master the art of rolling financial forecasting. Unleash your potential to optimize project financials and make informed decisions that drive project success.
Don't miss this exclusive opportunity to learn from Jamal, an esteemed expert in project and portfolio management. Enroll today and take a leap forward in enhancing your project financial forecasting skills.

All projects are a temporary effort to create value through a unique product, service or result. All projects have a beginning and an end. They have a team, a budget, a schedule and a set of expectations the team needs to meet. Each project is unique and differs from routine operations—the ongoing activities of an organization because projects reach a conclusion once the goal is achieved.
The changing nature of work due to technological advances, globalization and other factors means that, increasingly, work is organized around projects with teams being brought together based on the skills needed for specific tasks.

objectives: Delay Analysis Definition, Categories, Causes, Strengths and Weaknesses, methods to apply and required data for each method

Concurrent Delay Definition, Complexity and referred Contractual Provision
Different Approaches of Concurrent Delay (Dominant Cause, The Malmaison Approach, Apportionment and The Devlin Approach)
The Bespoke agreed Contract Terms & Conditions for Concurrent Delays and its cost & time entitlements.
requirements: No previous experience is needed.
courses.description: This course explores all issues about construction delays, its definitions, causes and impact, associated ramifications. Concurrent Delays are considered as one of the law problematical areas and most complicated & controversial kind of delay disputes. This is due to its unique/complex nature and the fact that there is no one standard and agreed coherent definition or interpretation of concurrent delay. We herein proposed various options for definition of concurrent delays, which its selection depends on how both parties agreed to deal with concurrency, along with proposed contractual bespoke agreed Clauses/ Provisions to reflect the contractor entitlement. Also application of detailed CPM delay analysis and application of Dominant Cause if applicable, “time-but-no-money” approach or Apportionment (preferably Apportionment of Time). And, further recommended the establishment of a UAE dedicated Technology and Construction Court Division that will definitely allow for more efficient resolution of construction industry complex disputes. Plus identifying and analyzing the basis and rules governing the determination of EOT in cases of concurrency under various civil and common law jurisdictions along with court’s relevant approach. It is concluded that Civil Law countries (such as USA, Scotland, Canada and Australia) preferred approach for concurrency is Apportionment. I guarantee it's such an interesting journey, I Hope you enjoy it.
target_audience: Planners, Contracts Administrators, Claims Engineers and Projects Control Engineers.

courses.description:
Nowadays, Project Managers are a key figure in any company or administration, since they allow to manage the different projects being executed with solvency. In this context and in my experience, the PMI PMP certification allows you to boost your professional career while publicly showing your knowledge in project management. However, achieving this certification requires a very intense study process, where mock exams are key to measure your level of preparation.


Beyond this theoretical idea, I imagine that if you are reading this is because you are preparing for the PMP certification exam. Therefore, you have already spent a considerable number of hours familiarizing yourself with the PMBOK v.7 and with its interesting concepts such as the WBS, Burndown/Burnup graphs, the soft/hard skills that a Project Manager must have, the importance of monitoring and controlling, the importance of agile methodologies, etc.


It is likely that for those of you who are going to prepare for the exam, once you have assimilated all these concepts, you will find it challenging to find a high-quality simulator with updated questions from the PMBOK v.7. This was my case, and that is why I decided to create this resource to help all those people who, like me, needed to test their knowledge with a tool that really simulates what the exam will be like.


This simulator is constantly evolving, so I will be adding new questions on a regular basis so that you can find all kinds of scenarios that can come up in the exam.

courses.bio: How to use Earned Value Analysis to track progress and communicate it clearly with one picture
objectives: After completing this course, students will be able to create a single diagram for that describes project :performance against schedule, actual cost versus budget and outlook for the remainder of the project

Core Course: Jargon buster for professional examination students
Bonus Lectures from Lean Project Managem: What are "Agile" and "Waterfall" approaches and how do they differ?
Other Bonus Material: Free book extract - Gardeners Not Mechanics: How to cultivate change at work

requirements: There are no prerequisites but you'll find it easier if you can use basic spreadsheet functions
courses.description:
After completing this course, you will be able to create a single diagram for your project or program that describes:

Performance against schedule
Actual cost versus budget
Outlook for the remainder of the project
Instead of presenting your sponsor and steering committee with a complicated mixture of milestone charts, spreadsheets, Gantt's and PERT's, you can give them one single picture whose meaning is understood in seconds. It's what they care about...THE BIG PICTURE.
I've been using Earned Value Analysis (EVA) for over 20 years with projects of all sizes and complexity (Waterfall, Agile and Lean) and I can guarantee that from my experience, it is the best way to track and communicate project status.
In this course, I take you step-by-step through the process of creating an EVA diagram, using a very simple example. But although the example is simple, it will teach you all of the principles you need to understand to use EVA for complex projects and even programs.
The course is delivered in a series of short videos, each one with a downloadable spreadsheet that show you how I worked through the example myslef. In addition, I have included a video that discusses how Earned Value Analysis can be applied to Agile and Lean projects.
I have also included some bonus videos from my Udemy Lean Project Management course that are not part of the EVA core course but explain some ideas and concepts that  I mention during the videos and that I think may  be of interest to you.
In my experience, a lot of people are put off using EVA because textbooks describe it using a set of barely comprehensible formulae and ratios. But the power of EVA is pictorial and that's they way you will learn it. Towards of the course is jargon buster video, just in case you need to know the "correct" formulae and ratios to quote in a professional examination.

To find out more about this course, I encourage you to watch the free introductory video which is available free. If you like what you see then sign up and take advantage of the 30-day, no questions asked, money back guarantee.
Gain your sponsor and steering committees confidence by joining me inside and starting to learn right now.
target_audience: Target student is anyone managing a project who wants to track and communicate progress quickly and easily

By practicing with timed tests, you will develop time management skills, reduce exam anxiety, and gain confidence in your ability to pass. Whether you're new to structured project management methodologies or looking to refine your knowledge, this course will help you achieve certification success.


Why You Should Enroll in This Course
Comprehensive Exam Preparation – Six full-length practice exams ensure complete coverage of managing projects in controlled environments principles.
720 High-Quality Questions – Designed to mirror the real certification exam, helping you understand structured project management methodologies.
Detailed Explanations – Every question comes with an in-depth explanation to reinforce learning and clarify key concepts.
Realistic Exam Simulation – Timed tests provide an authentic exam-day experience, allowing you to practice under real conditions.
Instant Performance Insights – Identify strengths and weaknesses to refine your study approach and improve your success rate.
Confidence Booster – Gain familiarity with the exam structure and question patterns to reduce uncertainty on exam day.
Lifetime Access – Study at your own pace with unrestricted access to the course and future updates.
Accessible on Any Device – Practice anytime, anywhere on mobile, tablet, or desktop for maximum convenience.
Boost Your Career – Earning a certification in managing projects in controlled environments can open doors to new job opportunities and career growth.
Expert-Curated Content – Developed by experienced project management professionals to help you succeed on your first attempt.


Exam Details:
Duration: 60 minutes
Number of Questions: 60 multiple-choice questions
Passing Score: 60% (36 correct answers out of 60)
Format: Closed book


Syllabus Overview:
The 7th Edition Foundation syllabus covers the following key areas:
Understanding Key Concepts:
Definition of the integrated elements: principles, people, practices, processes, and the project context.
Characteristics of a project and project management.
Aspects of project performance to be managed.
Various delivery approaches: linear-sequential, iterative-incremental, and hybrid.
Principles:
Ensure continued business justification.
Learn from experience.
Define roles, responsibilities, and relationships.
Manage by stages.
Manage by exception.
Focus on products.
Tailor to suit the project.
The Importance of People in Projects:
Organizational and project ecosystems.
Change management and its significance.
Stakeholder engagement and communication.
Building effective teams, emphasizing diversity, capability, and competence.
Practices:
Business Case: Developing and maintaining a justification for the project.
Organizing: Defining and establishing the project's structure of accountability and responsibilities.
Quality: Ensuring that the project's products meet their requirements.
Plans: Facilitating communication and control by defining the means of delivering the products.
Risk: Identifying, assessing, and controlling uncertainty.
Issues: Capturing and managing problems or concerns that arise during the project.
Progress: Monitoring and controlling the project's performance and progress.
Processes:
Starting Up a Project: Ensuring prerequisites for initiating a project are in place.
Directing a Project: Providing overall direction and decision-making.
Initiating a Project: Establishing a solid foundation for the project.
Controlling a Stage: Monitoring and controlling work at the stage level.
Managing Product Delivery: Controlling the link between the project manager and the team manager(s).
Managing a Stage Boundary: Ensuring that the project remains viable at each stage.
Closing a Project: Formalizing acceptance of the project and its products.
With a structured, exam-focused approach, this course is the ultimate tool for passing your project management certification. Enroll today and take the first step toward acing your exam!

This course is structured to ensure you gain a deep understanding of both the theory and practical applications of ChatGPT in product management. You will learn to apply AI-driven strategies across several core areas of product management, including market research, ideation, roadmapping, UX design, and marketing. Whether you are working on launching new products, improving existing ones, or conducting market research, ChatGPT will empower you to make smarter decisions more efficiently.
Course Modules and Key Topics:
Introduction to ChatGPT and Product Management
In the first module, you will be introduced to the basics of ChatGPT. You will learn what ChatGPT is, how it works, and why it is a valuable tool for product managers. This module will provide you with an understanding of how AI can fit into your existing product management workflows, helping you save time, reduce human error, and optimize your decision-making process.
Setting Up ChatGPT for Product Management
This module will dive into the practical setup of ChatGPT. We’ll cover the different tools, plugins, and integrations necessary for ChatGPT to work seamlessly within your team’s workflow. You’ll learn how to customize ChatGPT’s settings, tailor it to your specific needs, and integrate it into your daily operations.
Crafting Effective Prompts
One of the most important aspects of using ChatGPT effectively is knowing how to craft the right prompts. In this module, you will learn the art of prompt engineering, which involves crafting the right input to generate the most relevant and actionable outputs. You'll be provided with several examples of effective prompts and will practice creating your own for various product management tasks, such as market research, brainstorming, and prioritizing features.
Leveraging ChatGPT for Market Research and Ideation
Market research is essential to the success of any product, and ChatGPT can assist you in gathering and analyzing key insights. This module will teach you how to use ChatGPT to summarize market trends, analyze customer feedback, and generate new product ideas. You’ll also learn how to leverage ChatGPT’s capabilities to analyze competitor data and discover gaps in the market, allowing you to make informed decisions about your product roadmap.
Building and Managing Product Roadmaps
One of the core tasks of a product manager is to build and manage effective roadmaps. In this module, you’ll learn how ChatGPT can assist you in prioritizing features, defining product milestones, and creating a clear roadmap. You will also learn how to integrate customer feedback and data insights into your roadmap, ensuring alignment with business goals and market demand.
Optimizing UX Design and Marketing Campaigns with ChatGPT
In this module, we’ll cover how ChatGPT can improve your product's user experience (UX) design. You will learn how to use ChatGPT to suggest wireframes, user flows, and prototypes, helping you design intuitive and engaging products. Additionally, we will explore how ChatGPT can enhance your marketing efforts by generating ad copy, taglines, blog posts, and social media content tailored to your target audience.
Ethical Considerations and Real-World Applications
As with any AI tool, ethical considerations are essential when integrating ChatGPT into your workflow. In this module, you will learn about the ethical implications of using AI in product management, including how to avoid bias in AI outputs and ensure compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR. You will also explore real-world case studies of how companies have successfully implemented ChatGPT in their product management processes.
Interactive Resources and Exercises:
To make this course even more valuable, we have included several interactive resources and exercises that will help you apply what you’ve learned in real-world scenarios:
Self-Assessment Worksheet: Reflect on your current knowledge and expectations about ChatGPT in product management.
Action Plan Template: Create a personalized action plan for integrating ChatGPT into your workflow, complete with goal-setting and timeline guidance.
Marketing Content Planner: Use this interactive tool to organize and plan your marketing campaigns with templates for content creation.
Quiz & Assessments: Test your understanding of key concepts with engaging quizzes that reinforce the material covered in the course.
Who This Course is For:
This course is perfect for:
Product Managers who want to incorporate AI into their daily workflow and improve efficiency.
Aspiring Product Managers who want to gain an edge by learning how AI can be used in product management.
Entrepreneurs and Startup Founders who are looking to streamline their product development processes with the help of ChatGPT.
Business Professionals who want to integrate AI into their operations and optimize decision-making, from ideation to launch.
Why Choose This Course?
This course offers practical, hands-on knowledge with real-world examples and actionable insights that you can apply immediately in your product management role. You’ll gain a deeper understanding of how AI can transform your workflows, from automating repetitive tasks to generating new ideas and insights. Whether you’re looking to improve your product design, streamline market research, or innovate with AI, this course will provide you with the tools you need to succeed.
Conclusion:
By the end of this course, you will have the skills and confidence to effectively integrate ChatGPT into your product management workflow. You will be able to automate tasks, improve decision-making, enhance creativity, and drive innovation with the power of AI. The course is designed to help you work smarter, not harder, and to stay ahead in the ever-evolving world of product management.
Join us today and unlock the full potential of ChatGPT in your product management journey!

courses.description:
Are you ready to elevate your project management skills and achieve success in today’s fast-paced, dynamic work environment? Welcome to the *Certificate Course in Project Management*, a comprehensive, hands-on course designed to equip you with the essential tools and strategies to lead projects confidently and effectively, from start to finish.


This course covers everything you need to know to become a well-rounded project manager. Whether you’re new to project management or looking to refine your skills, this course dives deep into core principles, effective planning techniques, budgeting strategies, risk analysis, and so much more. By the end of this course, you’ll have the knowledge and skills to take on complex projects and drive them to successful completion.


What You’ll Learn


1. Foundations of Project Management
Understand the core concepts, principles, and frameworks that define effective project management. You’ll learn how to approach projects strategically and get a complete overview of what it takes to manage projects successfully.


2. Critical Path Method (CPM)
Master the Critical Path Method (CPM) to plan and schedule complex projects with confidence. CPM is an invaluable technique for identifying critical tasks and ensuring timely project delivery.


3. Project Planning and Scope Management
Develop skills in defining project scope and managing scope changes efficiently. Learn how to set clear goals, outline deliverables, and ensure every team member is aligned with the project’s objectives.


4. Time Management and Scheduling
Discover best practices for managing time effectively within a project. From scheduling tools to prioritization techniques, you’ll learn how to keep your project on track and prevent delays.


5. Cost Management and Budgeting
Gain the financial acumen to create, manage, and control project budgets. This module will help you estimate costs accurately, manage resources effectively, and avoid budget overruns.


6. Risk Management
Learn how to anticipate, analyze, and mitigate risks before they become major issues. This section covers strategies for proactive risk management that safeguard project success.


7. Communication Management
Communication is key to project success. You’ll explore how to establish strong communication channels, engage stakeholders, and ensure everyone is informed and on the same page.


8. Stakeholder’s Management
Explore the best practices for identifying, analyzing, and managing stakeholder relationships. You'll gain skills to handle expectations, foster support, and address stakeholder concerns effectively.


9. Procurement and Contract Management
Understand the essentials of procurement and contract management to ensure successful partnerships with vendors and contractors. Learn how to establish clear contracts and manage procurement smoothly.


10. Project Quality Management
Discover how to ensure quality throughout the project lifecycle. This module focuses on planning for quality, monitoring quality standards, and ensuring that deliverables meet all requirements.


11. Project Integration Management

courses.bio: Project Claim Management Principles, concepts
objectives: Principles of Project Claim
Situations leading to Project Claim
Issues related to Project Claim
Presentation of Claim
Importance of Record Keeping in Project Claims
Evaluation of Claim
Dispute Resolution
requirements: Experience in Project execution is preferable but not essential. None for students
courses.description:
This document provides concepts of claim management for projects (focus on EPC projects  in different sectors like power, fertiliser, oil & gas, infrastructure projects, etc). It includes tools and checklists to facilitate Claim Management.Claim Management involves handling claims effectively and fairly to minimise disputes and ensures compliance with contractual and legal obligations. This document is intended primarily for Project Managers, Engineering Managers and Site Managers in providing awareness and direction necessary to manage claims situations effectively.
Management of time and money claims is a team effort led by the Project Director/ Project Manager. Each member of the project team has responsibilities and roles to perform
The course includes
Principles of claim
Situations leading to claim,
Issues related to claim
Record keeping
Presentation of claim
Evaluation of claim
Dispute resolution
Example of how to lodge claim


A claim is a commercial demand in regard to money, schedules, technical or contractual content raised by one party of a contract against another because of variances or difficulties in connection with the fulfilment of the contract.
Claims can be directed from CONTRACTOR against the Employer, Supplier or Commercial Partner – or vice versa. In some cases, claims can be levied by an outside party against an CONTRACTOR company.
In extreme cases, an unresolved claim can lead to termination of the contract.
A claim brought by CONTRACTOR must not be viewed as an unmerited attack on the Employer but rather as a right to compensation for increased costs, extension of time or other disadvantages incurred by CONTRACTOR which were not within scope at the time of negotiation of the order.
A claim is generated by a failing or breach of obligation of a party’ or by the occurrence of an event for which the parties have pre-agreed that one party should bear the risk.
Having identified a breach or failing, established the cause and effect, the claim must then be substantiated and supported by documentation and the quantum, both in terms of time and cost
target_audience: This document is intended primarily for Project Managers and Site Managers in providing awareness and direction necessary to manage claims situations effectively
This document provides guidance; tools and checklists intended to facilitate Claims Management.

The order of the questions on each test is randomized, so that you can take the same test multiple times without being able to answer based on pattern recognition.


Our experience tells us that if you are consistently scoring 90% or more on these practice tests, this is a good indication that you should perform well on the actual test. Our advice is that you do not take the test if you are not consistently scoring 90% or more on these practice tests.

courses.title: PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (ACP) 2025 Mock Tests
courses.bio: Unleash Your Project Management Skills: Be Agile with PMI-ACP Certification.
courses.description:
The PMI-ACP (Project Management Institute Agile Certified Practitioner) certification is designed for professionals who specialize in Agile project management. It demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of Agile principles, tools, and techniques, validating expertise in this dynamic area of project management.
Key points about the PMI-ACP certification:
Eligibility:
A secondary degree (high school diploma, associate's degree, or the global equivalent).
2,000 hours of general project experience working on project teams.
1,500 hours of experience working with Agile methodologies.
21 hours of formal education in Agile practices.
Alternatively:
If you hold a PMP or PgMP certification, the general project experience requirement is waived, but the Agile-specific experience is still required.
Exam Content:
The PMI-ACP exam focuses on seven domains: Agile Principles and Mindset, Value-Driven Delivery, Stakeholder Engagement, Team Performance, Adaptive Planning, Problem Detection and Resolution, and Continuous Improvement.
Emphasis is placed on practical Agile tools and techniques used in managing Agile projects across various methodologies like Scrum, Kanban, Lean, and others.
Exam Format:
The PMI-ACP exam consists of 120 multiple-choice questions.
The exam duration is 3 hours.
Some of the questions are pre-test and do not count toward the final score but are included for statistical analysis.
Renewal:
The PMI-ACP certification is valid for three years.
To maintain certification, individuals must earn 30 professional development units (PDUs) in Agile project management within the three-year cycle.
Benefits:
Demonstrates specialized expertise in Agile project management, enhancing professional credibility.
Opens career opportunities by showcasing advanced skills in Agile methodologies.
Equips individuals with the knowledge to effectively lead Agile teams and manage Agile projects, contributing to improved project outcomes.
Like all PMI certifications, it's important to stay updated on eligibility requirements and exam content, as they may change. Exam preparation typically includes studying PMI’s Agile Practice Guide, relevant Agile frameworks, and hands-on experience with Agile tools and techniques.
target_audience: Tests intended for people planning to take the PMI ACP exam

courses.description:
Are you interested in pursuing a career in project management? Do you want to obtain the prestigious Project Management Professional (PMP) certification? As someone with over 20 years of experience in business and a passion for project management, I am thrilled to offer you my online course, "Foundations of PMP."
This course is designed for individuals who want to learn about the fundamentals of project management, including the processes, governance, and techniques required for project success. Throughout the course, you will learn about the various project management business documents, the environments in which projects operate, the differences between operations and projects, and the importance of the Project Management Office (PMO).
You will also learn about organizational and project governance, including the different organizational structures and the factors that determine their selection. You will delve into the role of the project manager, project initiator or sponsor, stakeholders, and functional managers. In addition, you will learn about the project management processes and project lifecycle, including the organizational process assets and enterprise environmental factors.
The course will cover the different estimation techniques used in project management, such as the one-point, analogous, parametric, three-point, and bottom-up estimation techniques. You will also learn about decision making, data gathering, data analysis, data representation, and the interpersonal and team skills required for project management.
Throughout the course, you will have access to quizzes and assessments to gauge your understanding of the topics covered. You will also be given the opportunity to work on various projects that will help you apply the concepts learned in the course to real-world scenarios.
One unique feature of this course is the full workbook provided to each student. This workbook consists of all the 1-page worksheets for each individual lesson, which are also available with each lesson. This will help you keep track of your progress and retain the information learned throughout the course.
Enrolling in "Foundations of PMP" will give you the knowledge and skills needed to excel in the field of project management and obtain the highly sought-after PMP certification. With my extensive experience and passion for project management, I am confident that this course will provide you with the value and expertise needed to achieve your career goals.

courses.title: Lean and Six Sigma Methods
courses.bio: Quality Management for Enterprises, Products, and Programs
objectives: Lean Principles: what are the 8 wastes, value stream mapping, creating flow, and implementing pull?
Six Sigma Overview: what does it mean, what are the roles, what is the training required?
What are the DMAIC steps?
How do you deploy Lean Six Sigma in the organization?
requirements: Basic understanding of quality management concepts
courses.description:
I will cover principles of the lean approach, and then I will present an overview of Six Sigma. Next, I will cover in detail the five steps of Six Sigma, often referred to by their initials DMAIC. Finally, I will show how Lean and Six Sigma can be deployed successfully in the organization.
The Lean Approach consists of five principles:
Specify value, and how to reduce or eliminate waste;
Identify steps in the value stream by using process maps, value/non-value decomposition, and by quantifying capacity and demand
Create flow by matching the pace of production to the average customer demand
Establish pull, thinking like a customer taking items from the supermarket shelf
Seek perfection through total productive maintenance
There are five standard steps in the six-sigma process:
Define the problem as clearly as one can in words
Measure the current level of performance and voice of the customer
Analyze collected data to determine the causes of the problem
Improve by selecting the right solutions to solve the problem
Control to make the improvement permanent
To deploy Lean Six Sigma you should develop a clear roadmap:
Decide to commit to lean six sigma, select a consultant, and prioritize activities
Prepare the infrastructure and train the participants
Launch the process in a wave of projects limited in scope and organizational impact
Expand to other divisions and levels of the organization after successful launch
Sustain the results and methods further training, empowerment, and audits
target_audience: Leaders, project managers, quality management teams

Introduction: Introduction to An Intermediate Guide to Practical Project Management

courses.description:
This intermediate project management course builds upon basic concepts and skills, providing learners with more advanced techniques and strategies to effectively manage projects.


This course covers topics such as project scope development, project planning (including project planning tools), risk management, task implementation, team leadership, stakeholder communication, and effectively closing projects to enhance project success.


This course is structured around the four fundamental phases of a medium sized project: The initiating, the planning, the execution, and the closing phases.


In the initiative phase, the course looks at what is project initiation, what happens in the initiating phase, what is in a project scope document and what does it look like, and what is scope control and scope management.


In the project planning phase, the course explores advanced methodologies for creating comprehensive project plans, defining objectives, estimating resources, and developing realistic schedules. It provides insights into effective techniques for prioritizing tasks, managing dependencies, and allocating resources efficiently. It also looks at risk management and communication plans.


In the project execution phase, this course works through what happens in the execution phase of a project, what a project manager's responsibilities are in executing the project, and how to carry them out so that the project is executed well.


Team leadership and stakeholder communication are essential aspects in the execution phase so this course will delve into techniques for effective leadership in a project, and  stakeholder engagement and communication to ensure project success and manage expectations.


This course will also explore techniques for monitoring project progress, tracking performance against objectives, managing change requests, and how to employ effective project control tools and methodologies to keep projects on track and deliver successful outcomes.


In the project closing phase, this course will look the steps required to effectively close a project, including managing resources, gathering data and reporting on outcomes.


This course provides lectures, quizzes and practice activities to hone your knowledge and developing skills.


By completing an intermediate course on project management, you will gain the necessary skills and knowledge to take on more challenging projects, navigate complexities, and achieve project success. It serves as a stepping stone for further professional growth and positions you for future leadership roles in project management.
target_audience: This course is designed for anyone with no, or limited, knowledge of project management and how it works.
The course will cover the key areas of project management, including project initiation, planning, execution, and closure.

courses.description:
PMP Mock Exam Questions - if you are able to pass the these exams with a 70% pass score you are well prepared in passing the PMP Exam.  These exams are timed so stay within the given timeframe.
Here are the questions on what is included in this exam prep which are similar to the exam that you will be taking:
Test your Knowledge - Warm up - 20 Questions - 2024
Practice Quiz #1 - 20 Questions (Domain - People) - 2024
Practice Quiz #2 - 20 Questions (Domain - Process) - 2024
Practice Quiz #3 - 10 Questions (Domain - Business Environment) - 2024
Practice Quiz #4 - 50 Questions - 2024
Practice Exam - 180 Questions - 2024
Tips on successfully passing the PMP:
Develop a study plan: Create a study schedule that works for you and stick to it. Make sure to allocate enough time for studying and practice.  It is recommended to have 80-100 hours of study time to prepare for the PMP exam
Manage your time effectively during the exam: Make sure to budget your time wisely during the exam. Don't spend too much time on any one question and try to answer the easier questions first.  You will have approx. 1min and 30 seconds to spend on each question.  180 questions with a time limit of 230 minutes.
Stay calm and focused: The PMP exam can be stressful, but it's important to stay calm and focused during the test. Take a few deep breaths and try to stay positive.
Be aware that questions may also include irrelevant information
The following tips can help you focus on most important problem in order to select the best answer
Determine immediate problem to address first
Deal with root cause first
Deal with problem with greatest negative impact first
Solve the problem that occurred the earliest
Look for a proactive solution
When you start the exam, take a couple minutes to write down anything you have trouble remembering.  It will help you free up your mind to handle exam questions once the information you are most concerned with is written down.
You will have access to a calculator during the exam.  The computer will have a calculator function and tutorial on how to use it
You can do this! Practice and repetition is the key to your learning.  Good luck in your studies!
target_audience: Aspiring individuals taking the PMP Certification Exam by PMI

courses.description:
Unlock Your Project Management Potential: A Comprehensive Journey Through PMP Certification

Have you ever marveled at the seamless execution of complex projects, whether it's the construction of towering skyscrapers, the successful launch of innovative tech products, or the efficient rollout of global marketing campaigns? Behind these achievements lies the disciplined, structured, and strategic framework of Project Management. In today's fast-paced and ever-evolving business landscape, the demand for skilled project managers is skyrocketing. These professionals stand at the helm of every project, steering it from conception through completion, ensuring not just success but excellence.

Our team is thrilled to introduce a meticulously designed course that not only prepares you for the globally recognized Project Management Professional (PMP) certification but also transforms you into a project leader who stands out in any industry. Drawing from decades of collective experience in project management across multi-faceted sectors, we've forged a curriculum that's both comprehensive and profoundly practical. Our passion for project management and its transformative power in the business sphere has propelled us to distill our knowledge, expertise, and insights into this course.

Why Project Management and Why Now?

The realm of project management is no longer confined to specific industries. Today, it's an indispensable skill across various sectors, driven by the increasing complexity of projects and the competitive need for efficiency and innovation. Whether you're looking to pivot your career, elevate your current project management role, or embed project management best practices into your business operations, mastering the principles of PMP certification is crucial.

This course isn't just about passing an exam; it's about equipping you with the knowledge, skills, and frameworks to excel in any project management endeavor. From technology and construction to healthcare and beyond, the applications of solid project management practices are both diverse and rewarding.

Embark On a Comprehensive Learning Journey

As you navigate through this immersive course, you'll embark on a structured journey through the core aspects of project management, as outlined by the Project Management Institute (PMI). Our curriculum spans across essential topics such as the evolution of project management, the impact of technology on project trends, global case studies, sector-specific applications, and much more.

Dive into the intricate world of project management ethics and professionalism, unravel the complexities of risk management strategies, and master financial management techniques crucial for project success. Delve into advanced problem-solving and decision-making, stakeholder management, as well as agile and hybrid project management methodologies.

What Sets Our Course Apart?

This course transcends the typical classroom approach, offering an interactive learning experience that's as engaging as it is educational. From the outset, you'll have the opportunity to apply what you learn through hands-on projects and real-world scenarios, ensuring that by the course's conclusion, you'll have a portfolio that showcases your comprehensive project management capabilities.

Our-learning journey is tailored for everyone, from beginners who are new to the domain of project management to seasoned professionals aiming to acquire the prestigious PMP certification. We break down complex concepts into digestible modules, guiding you step-by-step through each project with clarity and deep insights.

Features of Our Course:

- Real-World Applications: By integrating global case studies of PMP in action, we demonstrate the versatile and impactful nature of effective project management, offering you a panoramic view of its potential across different industries.

- Sector-Specific Insights: Delve into the nuances of project management across various sectors, including technology, construction, healthcare, non-profit organizations, and government projects. This diversity in application prepares you for a flexible career path, adaptable to any industry.

- Interactive Learning Experience: Our course is designed to be interactive and engaging, incorporating quizzes, assignments, and projects that not only test your knowledge but also enhance your understanding and application of project management principles.

- Continuous Support and Networking Opportunities: Join an enthusiastic community of fellow learners and professionals. Benefit from continuous support throughout your learning journey and beyond, opening doors to networking opportunities and professional growth.

Our mission is to not just lead you to the PMP certification but to mold you into a project management professional who brings unparalleled value to any team or project. This course stands as a beacon for those aspiring to excel in the dynamic, challenging, and rewarding field of project management.

Enroll now and start your journey toward becoming a certified Project Management Professional. Unlock your potential, elevate your career, and become part of the elite group of project managers who are shaping the future, one project at a time.

courses.description:
Are you tired of unproductive meetings that waste time and fail to achieve results? This course is your ultimate guide to mastering the art of effective meetings, equipping you with practical strategies to transform every meeting into a powerful tool for success. Designed for professionals, team leaders, managers, and entrepreneurs, this course will help you plan, lead, and follow up on meetings that are engaging, efficient, and results-driven.
In this course, you’ll learn how to set clear objectives, craft focused agendas, and select the right participants to ensure every meeting has purpose and direction. You’ll develop critical facilitation skills to keep discussions on track, manage conflicts, and foster collaboration. Plus, you’ll master professional communication techniques, including active listening, concise messaging, and the effective use of body language, to drive meaningful engagement.
The course also covers how to close meetings with clarity, assign actionable tasks, and implement effective follow-ups to maintain momentum. Avoid common pitfalls and learn proven strategies for evaluating meeting outcomes to continuously improve your approach.
By the end of this course, you’ll feel confident in leading productive meetings that save time, boost team efficiency, and deliver tangible results.
Perfect for beginners and seasoned professionals, this course will transform how you run meetings and set you apart as a leader in any professional setting.

courses.title: PMP Exam - PMI New Format 2025 (1080Q) (PMBOK 7 Updated)
courses.bio: 6 Full Length Mock Exams, Predicated, Agile and hybrid Questions. | Based on ECO + PMBOK® 6th/7th + Agile Guide
courses.description:
Ace the PMP® Exam with Realistic, High-Quality Practice Tests with explanations
Passing the PMP® exam requires more than just reading books or watching video tutorials. To truly succeed, you need to practice with exam-style questions that mirror the actual testing experience. This course is designed to give you that experience — so you can walk into the exam room confident, prepared, and ready to succeed on your first attempt.
The PMP® exam is predominantly scenario-based, testing your ability to apply concepts and choose the best course of action in real-world situations. Our 6 full-length mock exams, with a total of 1080 carefully crafted questions, follow the structure, style, and difficulty level of the real exam. These questions are aligned with the latest PMP Exam Content Outline (ECO) and cover all domains: People, Process, and Business Environment.
Each question comes with a detailed explanation — breaking down why the correct option is right and why the others are not. This ensures not only understanding, but also exam-taking strategy and decision-making skill development.
What You’ll Get:
6 Full-Length Practice Exams
• 180 questions each — that’s 1,080 questions in total + explanations
• Covers the entire latest Exam Content Outline (ECO)
• Reflects PMBOK® Guide 6th, 7th Edition & Agile Practice Guide
Exam-Accurate Timing & Format
• 4-hour time limit per exam
• Built to match the actual exam environment
• Scenario-based and calculation-intensive questions
Smart Features for Flexibility & Focus
• Option to pause and resume exams anytime
• Detailed, instructional explanations for every question
• Learn not just the “what,” but the “why” behind each answer
How to Gauge Your Readiness
Your mock exam scores offer a clear benchmark for how prepared you are for the real PMP® exam. Use the following ranges to guide your study strategy:
Below 55% – NOT READY
You have significant knowledge gaps. It’s recommended to revisit your study materials thoroughly before moving forward.
55% to 65% – TRY HARDER
You're getting there, but more focused practice is essential. Identify your weak areas and review them thoroughly.
65% to 75% – NEED IMPROVEMENT
You're close! Use your remaining prep time to refine understanding and take additional mock exams for reinforcement.
75% to 85% – ALMOST READY
You're in a strong position. Continue with light review and strategy refinement for maximum confidence.
Above 85% – YOU ARE READY
Outstanding performance. You are highly likely to score Above Target in all domains on the real exam.
Thousands of PMP aspirants have used these mock exams to pass the real exam on their first try. If you review every question, understand the rationale, and analyze your performance — you will be ready for exam day.

Projects do not always have to be centered on a professional setting. We complete projects all the time in our daily lives.
This course will show you how to structure your project from start to finish.
We will be looking specifically at network diagrams and how they can be used to structure our project and estimate times for completion.
We will also look at how to prioritize tasks within our project to ensure that we focus on the most important work and complete the project on time in the most optimal manner.
This is a step by step class aimed at providing derailed information on how network diagrams can be used to optimally structure a project. The use of network diagrams can provide immense benefits and help keep the project on track and aligned for success.
The following topics will be covered in this course:
How to create a network diagram
What is a work Package?
How to link dependencies in your project
How to estimate time for your project

how to identify the critical path in you project
The teachings of this course can be applied to any project to help structure and plan a project optimally and align it for success!
Network Diagrams helps identify areas and information that could not be obtained by only providing a list of work that needs to be completed. This additional information is often lost and the value within neglected.
This course aims to provide this knowledge in a concise manner so that it can be used with immediate effect.
I look forward to hearing from you and seeing you in the course!

courses.bio: Comprehensive PMP Exam Prep / Updated Syllabus / Challenging Practice for Elite Candidates / Real PMP Exam Simulation
courses.description:
PMP Certification Success: Project Management Practice Exams (NEW ) is your ultimate resource for acing the 2024 PMP® Certification Exam. This course is meticulously designed to provide you with a thorough and realistic preparation experience, ensuring you’re fully equipped to excel on exam day.
Inside this course, you’ll find:
Extensive Practice Tests:
Immerse yourself in eight practice tests, featuring a total of 270 exclusive questions. These questions cover a wide range of essential project management topics, reflecting the latest updates from the PMBOK® Guide. Engaging with these practice tests will deepen your understanding of critical concepts and scenarios, preparing you for the complexities of the actual exam.
In-Depth Explanations:
Each question is accompanied by a detailed explanation of the correct answer. These explanations go beyond simply providing the right answer—they delve into the underlying principles and methodologies, offering valuable insights to help you grasp the nuances of project management. This approach ensures that you not only learn the material but also understand how to apply it effectively.
Authentic Exam Experience:
Experience a realistic simulation of the PMP® exam environment, with questions that mirror the format and difficulty level of the actual test. This simulation helps you become familiar with the exam structure, refine your time management skills, and build the confidence needed to succeed.
Why Choose This Course?
By enrolling in PMP Certification Success: Project Management Practice Exams, you gain access to a total of 270 challenging questions spread across eight comprehensive practice tests. Each test is designed to challenge your knowledge and ensure you are well-prepared for every aspect of the PMI-PMP® exam. Whether you’re looking to validate your project management skills or enhance your mastery of advanced methodologies, this course offers a rigorous preparation strategy tailored for your success.
Elevate your project management career and achieve your professional goals with this detailed and realistic exam preparation course.
Available Exclusively on Udemy: Enroll in PMP Certification Success: Project Management Practice Exams today to access a comprehensive set of practice exams and essential preparation resources. Equip yourself with the knowledge and confidence needed to excel in the PMP® certification exam.


Ready for the PMP® exam?
Test your skills with 270 exclusive questions designed to match the real exam’s difficulty. Curious about the level of challenge? Explore our sample questions now and experience the rigor of our practice tests!


Question 1.
During a large-scale project, the project manager notices that the project is experiencing significant delays due to a critical vendor’s late deliveries. Despite the project team’s efforts to mitigate the delays, the project schedule is slipping, and the project manager anticipates that the project will not meet the planned completion date. The project sponsor is concerned about the potential impact on the project’s overall success. What should the project manager do next to address this issue?


A. Request additional resources from the project sponsor to expedite the vendor’s deliveries and get back on track.
B. Update the project schedule to reflect the new expected completion date and communicate this change to all stakeholders.
C. Initiate a formal change request to adjust the project scope to accommodate the delays caused by the vendor.
D. Conduct a root cause analysis to determine the underlying issues with the vendor’s performance and develop a corrective action plan.


Correct Answer: D. Conduct a root cause analysis to determine the underlying issues with the vendor’s performance and develop a corrective action plan.
Explanation:
The project manager should first conduct a root cause analysis to understand the specific reasons behind the vendor’s late deliveries. Identifying the underlying issues allows for the development of a targeted corrective action plan. This approach helps address the root cause of the problem rather than just reacting to the symptoms. While updating the schedule (Option B) or requesting additional resources (Option A) might be necessary later, understanding and resolving the root cause is crucial for long-term success and preventing recurrence.


Question 2.
You are the project manager for a large-scale construction project. During the project execution phase, you realize that the initial cost estimates were significantly underestimated due to unforeseen site conditions. The project is already halfway through, and budget overruns are imminent. Which of the following actions should you take first?


A. Immediately inform the project sponsor about the cost overrun and request additional funding.
B. Conduct a thorough cost variance analysis to determine the exact reasons for the cost overrun.
C. Implement a change control process to formally document the cost overrun and request necessary changes.
D. Re-estimate the remaining project work to assess the overall project cost and develop a contingency plan.


Correct Answer: B. Conduct a thorough cost variance analysis to determine the exact reasons for the cost overrun.
Explanation: Before taking any drastic actions, it's crucial to understand the root causes of the cost overrun. A thorough cost variance analysis will help identify the specific areas where costs have exceeded estimates and inform the next steps.


Question 3.
You are the project manager for a software development project using an Agile methodology. Your team is struggling to meet sprint goals due to frequent interruptions from stakeholders requesting additional features. How can you best manage stakeholder expectations and maintain project progress?


A. Create a strict change control process with rigorous approval requirements.
B. Explain the Agile methodology to stakeholders and emphasize the importance of the product backlog.
C. Establish regular communication channels with stakeholders to address their requests and manage expectations.
D. Ignore the stakeholder requests and focus solely on completing the current sprint backlog.


Correct Answer: C. Establish regular communication channels with stakeholders to address their requests and manage expectations.
Explanation: Open and regular communication is essential for managing stakeholder expectations in an Agile environment. While it's important to maintain focus on the current sprint, ignoring stakeholders' requests can lead to project dissatisfaction and potential risks. By establishing regular communication channels, you can effectively manage expectations and prioritize requests accordingly.


Question 4:
You are the project manager for a large construction project with a budget of $10 million. Halfway through the project, the cost performance index (CPI) is 0.75, and the schedule performance index (SPI) is 1.2. During a review meeting, the senior management questions the project's current status. Given that the planned value (PV) at this point is $6 million and the actual cost (AC) is $4.5 million, which of the following statements best describes the project's financial and schedule status?


A) The project is under budget but behind schedule, with cost overruns expected in the future.
B) The project is on budget and ahead of schedule, with no significant cost overruns anticipated.
C) The project is over budget and ahead of schedule, with a potential risk of cost overruns.
D) The project is under budget and ahead of schedule, with cost overruns expected due to inefficient cost management.


Correct Answer: A) The project is under budget but behind schedule, with cost overruns expected in the future.
Explanation: The CPI is calculated as EV/AC, where EV (Earned Value) = PV * SPI. Here, EV = $6 million * 1.2 = $7.2 million. The CPI = EV/AC = $7.2 million / $4.5 million = 1.6. However, since the CPI is given as 0.75 in the question, there might be an error in the EV calculation or provided values. Based on the provided CPI and AC, the cost is under budget (because CPI < 1), but the SPI indicates the project is ahead of schedule (because SPI > 1). Thus, the best interpretation is that the project is under budget but behind schedule, and future cost overruns might occur due to inefficient cost management practices.

The PMI-ACP (Agile Certified Practitioner) training program is an exclusive course designed to equip professionals with the skills and knowledge necessary to excel in the agile project management field. This comprehensive program combines hands-on experience with theoretical learning, providing participants with a unique opportunity to earn the prestigious PMI-ACP certification.


Throughout the course, participants will gain a deep understanding of various Agile methodologies, including Scrum, Lean, Kanban, and XP (Extreme Programming). They will learn how to effectively apply these methodologies to manage projects and deliver high-quality results in a dynamic and ever-changing business environment.


The program consists of a series of interactive training sessions, workshops, and practical exercises facilitated by Agile experts with extensive industry experience. Participants will be exposed to real-world scenarios and case studies, allowing them to apply Agile principles and techniques to solve complex project management challenges.


One of the key highlights of this training program is the emphasis on exam preparation. The PMI-ACP exam is known for its rigor, and this program ensures that participants are thoroughly prepared to pass the exam with confidence. The course covers all the exam domains and provides comprehensive study materials, mock exams, and guidance on exam-taking strategies.


In addition to exam preparation, the program also focuses on building essential Agile skills such as facilitating collaboration, managing stakeholder expectations, creating Agile project teams, and fostering continuous improvement. Participants will learn how to effectively lead Agile teams, communicate efficiently, manage risks, and adapt to changing project requirements.


Upon completion of the program, participants will be equipped with the knowledge and skills required to implement Agile practices in their organizations, drive successful projects, and enhance overall organizational performance. They will also receive the PMI-ACP certification, which is recognized globally as a hallmark of excellence in Agile project management.


Overall, the PMI-ACP training program is a comprehensive and unique opportunity for professionals looking to advance their careers in the Agile project management field. Whether you are a project manager, team leader, Scrum Master, Agile coach, or any other professional involved in project delivery, this program will empower you to excel in your role and contribute to the successful implementation of Agile practices in your organization.


The Project Management Institute-Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) , a widely accepted credential in the Agile community, is a reflection of the holder’s competence in carrying out project management using Agile practices. The certification mandatorily requires a combination of agile training, experience working on agile projects and a thorough comprehension of agile principles, practices, tools and techniques.
Considering that the number of organisations adopting Agile practices has increased exponentially over the past few years, the need for Project Management practitioners for implementing these agile techniques has also increased. Professionals who have worked on the Agile front as project managers or as team members have a lot to gain by aiming for the PMI- ACP certification as this can give them the edge they need to be recognised for a project manager’s role in an agile environment.


The PMI-ACP certification trains you to excel in an Agile environment with Agile practices and principles. Offered by the Project Management Institute (PMI) , the PMI-ACP is a globally recognized credential that gives its holders lucrative career opportunities and higher salary packages.
With a PMI-ACP certification, one can lead an Agile project team by reducing errors and risks and optimize the results that are being produced.
World over, organizations have realized the value of Agile practices and are in need of capable agile practitioners who can implement agile practices and help realize business objectives. The PMI-ACP certificate hence has great value not only among agilists but also recruiters hoping to fulfil industry hiring demands.

Agile methodology is redefining career aspects for many. Here are the benefits of getting PMI-ACP certified.

courses.title: Microsoft SureStep for Project Management
courses.bio: Unlock the power of Microsoft SureStep and learn how to manage projects efficiently, from initiation to completion.
objectives: Introduction to Microsoft SureStep: Understand the purpose and benefits of Microsoft SureStep in managing Microsoft Dynamics projects.
Key Project Concepts: Grasp essential project management concepts, including project challenges and lifecycle planning, to set the foundation.
Project Types and Phases: Learn about different project types within the SureStep methodology, as well as the specific phases each project undergoes.
Project Lifecycle Management: Gain insights into the steps involved in initiating, planning, executing, and closing projects within the SureStep framework.
Cross-Phase Management: Understand the importance of managing cross-phase activities and how they contribute to project success.
Project Management and Organizational Change Management (OCM): Explore the project management and OCM libraries within SureStep.
Roles in Project Management: Learn about the key roles within a Microsoft SureStep project and the responsibilities associated with each role.

Project Management and Organizational Ch: Project Management and OCM Libraries Continues

requirements: Basic Project Management Knowledge: A foundational understanding of project management concepts, such as project planning, scheduling, and execution, will be helpful.

Familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics: While not mandatory, a basic understanding of Microsoft Dynamics will be beneficial, as the course focuses on applying SureStep within the Microsoft Dynamics environment.
courses.description:
This course is a comprehensive guide to Microsoft SureStep, a project management methodology designed to facilitate the implementation of Microsoft Dynamics solutions. Through this course, students will gain in-depth knowledge of the project lifecycle, the various types of projects supported by Microsoft SureStep, and the best practices for managing projects, handling organizational change, and overcoming common project challenges. Whether you're new to Microsoft SureStep or seeking to enhance your skills, this course will equip you with the tools and frameworks necessary for successful project execution.
Section 1: Introduction
In this section, students will be introduced to the core principles of Microsoft SureStep, including its origins, its purpose, and how it integrates with Microsoft Dynamics solutions. The first lecture provides an overview of the methodology and the benefits of using SureStep for project management. Students will also be introduced to the key components of the framework that will set the stage for deeper understanding throughout the course.
Section 2: Understanding Project Key Concepts
This section dives into the foundational elements of project management within the Microsoft SureStep framework. It starts by examining the key concepts every project manager needs to know, followed by a discussion of the challenges faced by project teams. The section concludes with an in-depth look at project lifecycle planning, highlighting the steps involved in initiating, planning, executing, and closing a project within the SureStep model.
Section 3: Project Types in Microsoft SureStep Model
In this section, students will explore the different types of projects supported by the Microsoft SureStep methodology. The lectures cover various project types, followed by a detailed examination of the project phases that each project undergoes. Students will learn how to identify and manage these phases, as well as how to handle cross-phase activities that are critical to ensuring the smooth progression of a project.
Section 4: Project Management and Organizational Change Management Libraries
The final section delves into the libraries available within the Microsoft SureStep model, focusing on project management and organizational change management (OCM) libraries. These resources are designed to support project managers in their day-to-day activities and provide frameworks for handling organizational change. The section concludes with a discussion of roles within a project, including the responsibilities and expectations of project team members.
Conclusion:
By the end of this course, students will have a solid understanding of Microsoft SureStep, its project management methodologies, and the essential tools needed for successful project execution. They will be well-prepared to implement the SureStep methodology in real-world projects, overcome challenges, manage project phases efficiently, and handle organizational change. Whether you're managing a small team or overseeing a large-scale implementation, this course will equip you with the skills to lead projects successfully using the Microsoft SureStep framework.

courses.description:
Welcome to the World of Project Scheduling Mastery.


Have you ever wondered what it takes to master the art of Project Scheduling? Do you wish to lead projects with unparalleled efficiency and precision? Look no further, you're about to embark on a transformative journey through this course on Project Scheduling.


Unveiling the Power of Project Scheduling
Project scheduling is the backbone of project design and planning, encompassing every intricate detail from inception to completion. It's the blueprint that guides your project's activities, milestones, and deliverables with precision and finesse. This course takes you deep into the heart of this essential discipline.


What Awaits You in this Comprehensive Course?


This meticulously crafted course is based on industry-standard project management practices. It will equip you with a profound understanding of Project Scheduling, empowering you to create, analyze, and control project schedules like a true expert.


Why is this course important?


Many individuals dive straight into software courses like Primavera or MS Project, but the truth is, that true mastery begins with a solid grasp of the fundamentals. This course provides you with all the knowledge, skills, and techniques necessary to become a top-notch planner/scheduler.


Course Objectives
Strategic Scheduling: This course will guide you in developing your skills for gathering project-specific information essential for scheduling.
Activity Definition: Learn how to define activities within a schedule.
Sequencing Mastery: Discover the art of sequencing activities using logical relationships and network logic diagramming.
Duration Estimation: Explore various methods for estimating activity durations.
Critical Path Insight: Grasp the intricacies of the Critical Path Method (CPM) and its application.
Resource Loading: Learn how to load resources onto your schedule effectively.
Optimization Techniques: Discover ways to shorten project durations while meeting your schedule targets.
Quality Assurance: Understand the critical checks and analyses needed to verify your schedule.
Baseline Establishment: Dive into the step-by-step process of creating a schedule baseline.
Data Gathering: Learn the art of collecting data to update your schedule.

courses.title: Agile: Adopt SAFe Methodologies And Scale Lean Practices
courses.bio: Drive Organisational Agility And Enterprise-Wide Innovation With Scalable Lean Practices
objectives: Understand the fundamental principles of SAFe.
Recognise the core components of SAFe.

Adopt SAFe Methodologies And Scale Your: Benefits Of SAFe For Business Leaders

requirements: No specific requirements.
courses.description:
Do you want to implement a framework that fosters higher levels of productivity and efficiency in your organisation? Are you interested in learning the core components of SAFe to transform the workflow of complex projects for your business? Would it be helpful for you to implement SAFe and scale agile practises across all departments to boost project outcomes? If you answered yes to any of these questions, then this course is for you!
SAFe, or the Scaled Agile Framework, in essence, is a mindset for businesses that want to adopt a more flexible and efficient workflow for organisational projects. SAFe is part of the agile methodology, which was pioneered in 2011 for the software development industry to make development workflows more adaptive to market changes and customer needs. These methodologies focused on creating a decentralised system for decision-making, to speed up workflows, emphasise deconstructing large tasks and completing complex project tasks into smaller sections. Thereby ensuring continuous delivery and improvement with each work cycle. A report by American professional services giant McKinsey showed that 70% of organisations believe that agility is one of the top three factors necessary for business success today, with agile approaches fostering better adaptability and faster response times to market changes. This statistic highlights how agile practises boost workflows by empowering teams to be more adaptable and flexible. And that is exactly what this course will help you to do!
Over a series of short video lectures, we will dive into the world of the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), a powerful methodology designed to help you navigate the complexities of scaling agile practices across large organisations. You will uncover the foundational principles of SAFe, starting with a clear understanding of its basics and recognising the core components that make it so effective. We'll explore Lean Portfolio Management (LPM) in depth, helping you develop strategies to align organisational goals with execution while maximising value delivery. We'll guide you through the steps to scale agile practices across teams, departments and enterprise-wide, ensuring seamless collaboration and cohesion. Along the way, you will gain insights into the business benefits of SAFe, equipping you to communicate its advantages to stakeholders and build momentum for organisational transformation. Not only will you highlight SAFe’s value for business leaders, but you’ll also integrate proven best practices for implementing SAFe, preparing you to lead with confidence and precision.
By the end of this course, you will be able to not only enhance workplace productivity and project outcomes but also successfully scale the SAFe model across your organisation. Enrol now to learn more!
target_audience: Business leaders responsible for guiding teams within large organisations, ensuring that agile practices are implemented effectively.
Project managers coordinating cross-functional teams in complex, large-scale projects, ensuring timely delivery, resource management.
Department heads leading multiple agile teams, focusing on achieving business goals while fostering collaboration.

Operations managers managing business processes and workflows, ensuring that agile practises help optimise operations.

courses.title: PRINCE2 Revision Pack
courses.bio: 6 PRINCE2 Mock Exams with enhanced Practitioner rationales and revision cards to help you prepare for the exams.
courses.description:
Balance Global’s elite revision experience
This unique PRINCE2 revision bundle will really help you prepare for the official PRINCE2 Foundation and Practitioner Exams. The Exam Insitute Peoplecert officially provides 2 practice papers for Foundation level and 2 papers for practitioner level. Students often ask to request for additional resources to help prepare for exams. So we have created this revision pack to help with that!


What’s included
Balance Global’s revision bundle includes the following:
2 official PRINCE2 foundation papers provided by the EI (Axelos/Peoplecert)
2 additional non EI foundation papers written by our lead trainer (Jackie Hewett) who has been teaching PRINCE2 for over 13 years and taught 3 different versions of the method to thousand of students. You can therefore be assured that these extra papers do relate to the 6th edition of PRINCE2 and have been written by someone with great depth of knowledge and experience.
Enhanced rationales for the 2 official practitioner papers. We feel that ATO’s creating their own practitioner papers actually poses a big risk to students understanding the method properly. This is because trainers are not the chief examiner and therefore reputable ATOs do not do this! We have therefore decided that the best way to help students prepare for the official practitioner exam is to work with the official exam institiute practice papers but give you the deepest explanation possible.


Always be cautious
Students need to take extreme caution when looking for additional exam peparation resources for the following reasons:
You need to ensure practice questions relate to the current version of PRINCE2 (6th edition) because there are questions in the public domain that relate to old versions of PRINCE2, and the version they relate to may not be made clear. Questions that relate to old versions will only confuse you as there have been some changes to the method.
Some unscrupulous ATO’s have put live papers into the public domain, which you may think would be a good thing. However, not if the provider indicates that wrong answers are correct because they don’t actually know better! We have seen this happen many times!
Non EI provided questions. When a provider offers more than 2 practice papers, they will have made-up the additional questions/papers themselves. You need to be careful regarding which provider you choose as the calibre of trainers who have written the questions varies a lot. First, you need to make sure questions have been written by an approved trainer and also understand the experience of that trainer.
target_audience: This revision pack is intended for those who want to get into or are in Project Management
This revision pack is intended for those who are learning or want to learn PRINCE2, or have learnt PRINCE2 and want to refresh knowledge.
